param.name: Blimp:FORMAT_VERSION
param.documentation: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

param.name: Blimp:PILOT_THR_FILT
param.documentation: Throttle filter cutoff (Hz) - active whenever altitude control is inactive - 0 to disable

param.name: Blimp:PILOT_THR_BHV
param.documentation: Bitmask containing various throttle stick options. TX with sprung throttle can set PILOT_THR_BHV to "1" so motor feedback when landed starts from mid-stick instead of bottom of stick.
param.field: 0:Feedback from mid stick,1:High throttle cancels landing,2:Disarm on land detection

param.name: Blimp:GCS_PID_MASK
param.documentation: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

param.name: Blimp:FS_GCS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked (and what action to take) when connection with Ground station is lost for at least 5 seconds. See FS_OPTIONS param for additional actions, or for cases allowing Mission continuation, when GCS failsafe is enabled.

param.name: Blimp:GPS_HDOP_GOOD
param.documentation: GPS Hdop value at or below this value represent a good position. Used for pre-arm checks

param.name: Blimp:FS_THR_ENABLE
param.documentation: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel

param.name: Blimp:FS_THR_VALUE
param.documentation: The PWM level in microseconds on channel 3 below which throttle failsafe triggers

param.name: Blimp:THR_DZ
param.documentation: The deadzone above and below mid throttle in PWM microseconds. Used in AltHold, Loiter, PosHold flight modes

param.name: Blimp:FLTMODE1
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is <= 1230

param.name: Blimp:FLTMODE2
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1230, <= 1360

param.name: Blimp:FLTMODE3
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1360, <= 1490

param.name: Blimp:FLTMODE4
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1490, <= 1620

param.name: Blimp:FLTMODE5
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1620, <= 1749

param.name: Blimp:FLTMODE6
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >=1750

param.name: Blimp:FLTMODE_CH
param.documentation: RC Channel to use for flight mode control

param.name: Blimp:INITIAL_MODE
param.documentation: This selects the mode to start in on boot.

param.name: Blimp:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: Bitmap of what log types to enable in on-board logger. This value is made up of the sum of each of the log types you want to be saved. On boards supporting microSD cards or other large block-storage devices it is usually best just to enable all basic log types by setting this to 65535.
param.field: 0:Fast Attitude,1:Medium Attitude,2:GPS,3:System Performance,4:Control Tuning,6:RC Input,7:IMU,9:Battery Monitor,10:RC Output,12:PID,13:Compass

param.name: Blimp:DISARM_DELAY
param.documentation: Delay before automatic disarm in seconds. A value of zero disables auto disarm.

param.name: Blimp:FS_EKF_ACTION
param.documentation: Controls the action that will be taken when an EKF failsafe is invoked

param.name: Blimp:FS_EKF_THRESH
param.documentation: Allows setting the maximum acceptable compass and velocity variance

param.name: Blimp:FS_CRASH_CHECK
param.documentation: This enables automatic crash checking. When enabled the motors will disarm if a crash is detected.

param.name: Blimp:MAX_VEL_XY
param.documentation: Sets the maximum XY velocity, in m/s

param.name: Blimp:MAX_VEL_Z
param.documentation: Sets the maximum Z velocity, in m/s

param.name: Blimp:MAX_VEL_YAW
param.documentation: Sets the maximum yaw velocity, in rad/s

param.name: Blimp:MAX_POS_XY
param.documentation: Sets the maximum XY position change, in m/s

param.name: Blimp:MAX_POS_Z
param.documentation: Sets the maximum Z position change, in m/s

param.name: Blimp:MAX_POS_YAW
param.documentation: Sets the maximum Yaw position change, in rad/s

param.name: Blimp:SIMPLE_MODE
param.documentation: Simple mode for Position control - "forward" moves blimp in +ve X direction world-frame

param.name: Blimp:DIS_MASK
param.documentation: Mask for disabling (setting to zero) one or more of the 4 output axis in mode Velocity or Loiter

param.name: Blimp:PID_DZ
param.documentation: Output 0 thrust signal when blimp is within this distance (in meters) of the target position. Warning: If this param is greater than MAX_POS_XY param then the blimp won't move at all in the XY plane in Loiter mode as it does not allow more than a second's lag. Same for the other axes.

param.name: Blimp:RC_SPEED
param.documentation: This is the speed in Hertz that your ESCs will receive updates

param.name: Blimp:VELXY_P
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) P gain. Converts the difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELXY_I
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) I gain. Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELXY_D
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) D gain. Corrects short-term changes in velocity

param.name: Blimp:VELXY_IMAX
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: Blimp:VELXY_FLTE
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.name: Blimp:VELXY_FLTD
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D term

param.name: Blimp:VELXY_FF
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) feed forward gain. Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELZ_P
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) P gain. Converts the difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELZ_I
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) I gain. Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELZ_D
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) D gain. Corrects short-term changes in velocity

param.name: Blimp:VELZ_IMAX
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: Blimp:VELZ_FLTE
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.name: Blimp:VELZ_FLTD
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D term

param.name: Blimp:VELZ_FF
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) feed forward gain. Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELYAW_P
param.documentation: Velocity (yaw) P gain. Converts the difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELYAW_I
param.documentation: Velocity (yaw) I gain. Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELYAW_D
param.documentation: Velocity (yaw) D gain. Corrects short-term changes in velocity

param.name: Blimp:VELYAW_IMAX
param.documentation: Velocity (yaw) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: Blimp:VELYAW_FLTE
param.documentation: Velocity (yaw) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.name: Blimp:VELYAW_FF
param.documentation: Velocity (yaw) feed forward gain. Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:POSXY_P
param.documentation: Position (horizontal) P gain. Converts the difference between desired and actual position to a target velocity

param.name: Blimp:POSXY_I
param.documentation: Position (horizontal) I gain. Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual position to a target velocity

param.name: Blimp:POSXY_D
param.documentation: Position (horizontal) D gain. Corrects short-term changes in position

param.name: Blimp:POSXY_IMAX
param.documentation: Position (horizontal) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: Blimp:POSXY_FLTE
param.documentation: Position (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.name: Blimp:POSXY_FLTD
param.documentation: Position (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D term

param.name: Blimp:POSXY_FF
param.documentation: Position (horizontal) feed forward gain. Converts the difference between desired position to a target velocity

param.name: Blimp:POSZ_P
param.documentation: Position (vertical) P gain. Converts the difference between desired and actual position to a target velocity

param.name: Blimp:POSZ_I
param.documentation: Position (vertical) I gain. Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual position to a target velocity

param.name: Blimp:POSZ_D
param.documentation: Position (vertical) D gain. Corrects short-term changes in position

param.name: Blimp:POSZ_IMAX
param.documentation: Position (vertical) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: Blimp:POSZ_FLTE
param.documentation: Position (vertical) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.name: Blimp:POSZ_FLTD
param.documentation: Position (vertical) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D term

param.name: Blimp:POSZ_FF
param.documentation: Position (vertical) feed forward gain. Converts the difference between desired position to a target velocity

param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_P
param.documentation: Position (yaw) axis controller P gain.

param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_I
param.documentation: Position (yaw) axis controller I gain.

param.humanName: Position (yaw) axis controller I gain maximum
param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_IMAX
param.documentation: Position (yaw) axis controller I gain maximum.

param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_D
param.documentation: Position (yaw) axis controller D gain.

param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_FF
param.documentation: Position (yaw) axis controller feed forward

param.humanName: Position (yaw) target frequency filter in Hz
param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_FLTT
param.documentation: Position (yaw) target frequency filter in Hz

param.humanName: Position (yaw) error frequency filter in Hz
param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_FLTE
param.documentation: Position (yaw) error frequency filter in Hz

param.humanName: Position (yaw) derivative input filter in Hz
param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_FLTD
param.documentation: Position (yaw) derivative input filter in Hz

param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains.

param.humanName: Position (yaw) axis controller PD sum maximum
param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_PDMX
param.documentation: Position (yaw) axis controller PD sum maximum. The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output

param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_D_FF
param.documentation: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_NTF
param.documentation: Position (yaw) Target notch filter index

param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_NEF
param.documentation: Position (yaw) Error notch filter index

param.name: Blimp:DEV_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Bitmask of developer options. The meanings of the bit fields in this parameter may vary at any time. Developers should check the source code for current meaning

param.name: Blimp:FRAME_CLASS
param.documentation: Controls major frame class for blimp.

param.name: Blimp:PILOT_SPEED_DN
param.documentation: The maximum vertical descending velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

param.name: Blimp:FS_VIBE_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the vibration failsafe which will use modified altitude estimation and control during high vibrations

param.name: Blimp:FS_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Bitmask of additional options for battery, radio, & GCS failsafes. 0 (default) disables all options.

bitmask.bit: Continue if in pilot controlled modes on GCS failsafe

param.field: 4:Continue if in pilot controlled modes on GCS failsafe

param.name: Blimp:FS_GCS_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: Timeout before triggering the GCS failsafe

param.name: TERR_BRK_ENABLE
param.documentation: terrain brake enable

param.name: TERR_BRK_ALT
param.documentation: terrain brake altitude. The altitude above the ground below which BRAKE mode will be engaged if in LOITER mode.

param.name: TERR_BRK_HDIST
param.documentation: terrain brake home distance. The distance from home where the auto BRAKE will be enabled. When within this distance of home the script will not activate

param.name: TERR_BRK_SPD
param.documentation: terrain brake speed threshold. Don't trigger BRAKE if both horizontal speed and descent rate are below this threshold. By setting this to a small value this can be used to allow the user to climb up to a safe altitude in LOITER mode. A value of 0.5 is recommended if you want to use LOITER to recover from an emergency terrain BRAKE mode change.

param.name: DR_ENABLE
param.documentation: Deadreckoning Enable

param.name: DR_ENABLE_DIST
param.documentation: Distance from home (in meters) beyond which the dead reckoning will be enabled

param.humanName: Deadreckoning GPS speed accuracy maximum threshold
param.name: DR_GPS_SACC_MAX
param.documentation: GPS speed accuracy maximum, above which deadreckoning home will begin (default is 0.8). Lower values trigger with good GPS quality, higher values will allow poorer GPS before triggering. Set to 0 to disable use of GPS speed accuracy

param.humanName: Deadreckoning GPS satellite count min threshold
param.name: DR_GPS_SAT_MIN
param.documentation: GPS satellite count threshold below which deadreckoning home will begin (default is 6). Higher values trigger with good GPS quality, Lower values trigger with worse GPS quality. Set to 0 to disable use of GPS satellite count

param.name: DR_GPS_TRIGG_SEC
param.documentation: GPS checks must fail for this many seconds before dead reckoning will be triggered

param.name: DR_FLY_ANGLE
param.documentation: lean angle (in degrees) during deadreckoning

param.name: DR_FLY_ALT_MIN
param.documentation: Copter will fly at at least this altitude (in meters) above home during deadreckoning

param.name: DR_FLY_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: Copter will attempt to switch to NEXT_MODE after this many seconds of deadreckoning. If it cannot switch modes it will continue in Guided_NoGPS. Set to 0 to disable timeout

param.name: DR_NEXT_MODE
param.documentation: Copter switch to this mode after GPS recovers or DR_FLY_TIMEOUT has elapsed. Default is 6/RTL. Set to -1 to return to mode used before deadreckoning was triggered

param.name: POI_DIST_MAX
param.documentation: POI's max distance (in meters) from the vehicle

param.name: BATT_SOC_COUNT
param.documentation: Number of battery SOC estimators

param.name: BATT_SOC1_IDX
param.documentation: Battery estimator index

param.name: BATT_SOC1_NCELL
param.documentation: Battery estimator cell count

param.name: BATT_SOC1_C1
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient1

param.name: BATT_SOC1_C2
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient2

param.name: BATT_SOC1_C3
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient3

param.name: BATT_SOC1_C4
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient4

param.name: BATT_SOC2_IDX
param.documentation: Battery estimator index

param.name: BATT_SOC2_NCELL
param.documentation: Battery estimator cell count

param.name: BATT_SOC2_C1
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient1

param.name: BATT_SOC2_C2
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient2

param.name: BATT_SOC2_C3
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient3

param.name: BATT_SOC2_C4
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient4

param.name: BATT_SOC3_IDX
param.documentation: Battery estimator index

param.name: BATT_SOC3_NCELL
param.documentation: Battery estimator cell count

param.name: BATT_SOC3_C1
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient1

param.name: BATT_SOC3_C2
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient2

param.name: BATT_SOC3_C3
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient3

param.name: BATT_SOC3_C4
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient4

param.name: BATT_SOC4_IDX
param.documentation: Battery estimator index

param.name: BATT_SOC4_NCELL
param.documentation: Battery estimator cell count

param.name: BATT_SOC4_C1
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient1

param.name: BATT_SOC4_C2
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient2

param.name: BATT_SOC4_C3
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient3

param.name: BATT_SOC4_C4
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient4

param.name: ARM_SYSID
param.documentation: Check that MAV_SYSID (or SYDID_THISMAV) has been set. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.name: ARM_FOLL_SYSID
param.documentation: If FOLL_ENABLE = 1, check that FOLL_SYSID has been set. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.name: ARM_FOLL_SYSID_X
param.documentation: If FOLL_ENABLE = 1, check that FOLL_SYSID is different to MAV_SYSID. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.name: ARM_FOLL_OFS_DEF
param.documentation: Follow offsets should not be left as default (zero) if FOLL_ENABLE = 1. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.humanName: Follow and Mount should follow the same vehicle
param.name: ARM_MNTX_SYSID
param.documentation: If FOLL_ENABLE = 1 and MNTx_SYSID_DEFLT is set, check that FOLL_SYSID is equal MNTx. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.humanName: RTL_CLIMB_MIN should be a valid value
param.name: ARM_RTL_CLIMB
param.documentation: RTL_CLIMB_MIN should be < 120m (400ft). 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.name: ARM_ESTOP
param.documentation: Emergency Stop disables arming. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.name: ARM_FENCE
param.documentation: Fences loaded but no fence enabled. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.name: ARM_RALLY
param.documentation: Rally Point more than RALLY_LIMIT_KM kilometers away. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.humanName: RTL_ALT_M should be a valid value
param.name: ARM_C_RTL_ALT_M
param.documentation: RTL_ALT_M should be < 120m (400ft). 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.humanName: Warn if Q failsafe will land
param.name: ARM_P_Q_FS_LAND
param.documentation: Notify the user that on failsafe a QuadPlan will land. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.humanName: Warn if Q failsafe will QRTL
param.name: ARM_P_Q_FS_RTL
param.documentation: Notify the user that on failsafe a QuadPlan will QRTL. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.name: ARM_P_AIRSPEED
param.documentation: Validate that AIRSPEED_STALL(if set) < MIN < CRUISE < MAX d. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.name: ARM_P_STALL
param.documentation: Validate that AIRSPEED_MIN is at least 25% above AIRSPEED_STALL(if set). 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.name: ARM_P_SCALING
param.documentation: Validate that SCALING_SPEED is within 20% of AIRSPEED_CRUISE. If SCALING_SPEED changes the vehicle may need to be retuned. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.humanName: RTL_ALTITUDE should be a valid value
param.name: ARM_P_RTL_ALT
param.documentation: RTL_ALTITITUDE should be < 120m (400ft). 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.humanName: Q_RTL_ALT should be a valid value
param.name: ARM_P_QRTL_ALT
param.documentation: Q_RTL_ALT should be < 120m (400ft). 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

param.name: ARM_V_ALT_LEGAL
param.documentation: Legal max altitude for UAV/RPAS/drones in your jurisdiction

param.name: ALAND_ENABLE
param.documentation: enable Auto land script action

param.name: ALAND_WP_ALT
param.documentation: Altitude of final approach waypoint created by script

param.name: ALAND_WP_DIST
param.documentation: Distance from landing point (HOME) to final approach waypoint created by script in the opposite direction of initial takeoff

param.name: QUIK_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable quicktune system

param.name: QUIK_AXES
param.documentation: axes to tune

param.name: QUIK_DOUBLE_TIME
param.documentation: Time to double a tuning parameter. Raise this for a slower tune.

param.name: QUIK_GAIN_MARGIN
param.documentation: Reduction in gain after oscillation detected. Raise this number to get a more conservative tune

param.name: QUIK_OSC_SMAX
param.documentation: Threshold for oscillation detection. A lower value will lead to a more conservative tune.

param.name: QUIK_YAW_P_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum value for yaw P gain

param.name: QUIK_YAW_D_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum value for yaw D gain

param.name: QUIK_RP_PI_RATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between P and I gains for roll and pitch. Raise this to get a lower I gain

param.name: QUIK_Y_PI_RATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between P and I gains for yaw. Raise this to get a lower I gain

param.name: QUIK_AUTO_FILTER
param.documentation: When enabled the PID filter settings are automatically set based on INS_GYRO_FILTER

param.name: QUIK_AUTO_SAVE
param.documentation: Number of seconds after completion of tune to auto-save. This is useful when using a 2 position switch for quicktune

param.name: QUIK_RC_FUNC
param.documentation: RCn_OPTION number to use to control tuning stop/start/save

param.name: QUIK_MAX_REDUCE
param.documentation: This controls how much quicktune is allowed to lower gains from the original gains. If the vehicle already has a reasonable tune and is not oscillating then you can set this to zero to prevent gain reductions. The default of 20% is reasonable for most vehicles. Using a maximum gain reduction lowers the chance of an angle P oscillation happening if quicktune gets a false positive oscillation at a low gain, which can result in very low rate gains and a dangerous angle P oscillation.

param.name: QUIK_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Additional options. When the Two Position Switch option is enabled then a high switch position will start the tune, low will disable the tune. you should also set a QUIK_AUTO_SAVE time so that you will be able to save the tune.

param.humanName: maximum angle error for tune abort
param.name: QUIK_ANGLE_MAX
param.documentation: If while tuning the angle error goes over this limit then the tune will aborts to prevent a bad oscillation in the case of the tuning algorithm failing. If you get an error "Tuning: attitude error ABORTING" and you think it is a false positive then you can either raise this parameter or you can try increasing the QUIK_DOUBLE_TIME to do the tune more slowly. A value of zero disables this check.

param.name: CAM1_THERM_PAL
param.documentation: thermal image colour palette

param.name: CAM1_THERM_GAIN
param.documentation: thermal image temperature range

param.name: CAM1_THERM_RAW
param.documentation: save images with raw temperatures

param.name: FOLLP_FAIL_MODE
param.documentation: Mode to switch to if the target is lost (no signal or > FOLL_DIST_MAX).

param.name: FOLLP_EXIT_MODE
param.documentation: Mode to switch to when follow mode is exited normally

param.name: FOLLP_ACT_FN
param.documentation: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for Plane Follow enable/disable

param.name: FOLLP_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: How long to try reaquire a target if telemetry from the lead vehicle is lost.

param.name: FOLLP_OVRSHT_DEG
param.documentation: If the target is greater than this many degrees left or right, assume an overshoot

param.name: FOLLP_TURN_DEG
param.documentation: If the target is greater than this many degrees left or right, assume it's turning

param.name: FOLLP_DIST_CLOSE
param.documentation: When closer than this distance assume we track by heading

param.name: FOLLP_WIDE_TURNS
param.documentation: Use wide turns when following a turning target. Alternative is "cutting the corner"

param.name: FOLLP_ALT
param.documentation: When non zero, this altitude value (in FOLL_ALT_TYPE frame) overrides the value sent by the target vehicle

param.humanName: Plane Follow Scripting distance P gain
param.name: FOLLP_D_P
param.documentation: P gain for the speed PID controller distance component

param.humanName: Plane Follow Scripting distance I gain
param.name: FOLLP_D_I
param.documentation: I gain for the speed PID distance component

param.humanName: Plane Follow Scripting distance D gain
param.name: FOLLP_D_D
param.documentation: D gain for the speed PID controller distance component

param.humanName: Plane Follow Scripting speed P gain
param.name: FOLLP_V_P
param.documentation: P gain for the speed PID controller velocity component

param.humanName: Plane Follow Scripting speed I gain
param.name: FOLLP_V_I
param.documentation: I gain for the speed PID controller velocity component

param.humanName: Plane Follow Scripting speed D gain
param.name: FOLLP_V_D
param.documentation: D gain for the speed PID controller velocity component

param.name: FOLLP_LkAHD
param.documentation: Time to "lookahead" when calculating distance errors

param.humanName: Plane Follow Simulate Telemetry fail function
param.name: FOLLP_SIM_TLF_FN
param.documentation: Set this switch to simulate losing telemetry from the other vehicle

param.humanName: Plane Follow crosstrack PID controller P term
param.name: FOLLP_XT_P
param.documentation: P term for the crosstrack/heading PID controller

param.humanName: Plane Follow crosstrack PID controller I term
param.name: FOLLP_XT_I
param.documentation: I term for the crosstrack/heading PID controller

param.humanName: Plane Follow crosstrack PID controller D term
param.name: FOLLP_XT_D
param.documentation: D term for the crosstrack/heading PID controller

param.humanName: Plane Follow crosstrack PID controller maximum correction
param.name: FOLLP_XT_MAX
param.documentation: maximum correction retured by the crosstrack/heading PID controller

param.humanName: Plane Follow crosstrack PID controller maximum integral
param.name: FOLLP_XT_I_MAX
param.documentation: maximum I applied the crosstrack/heading PID controller

param.name: FOLLP_REFRESH
param.documentation: refresh rate for Plane Follow updates

param.name: ESRC_EXTN_THRESH
param.documentation: ExternalNav may be used if innovations are below this threshold

param.name: ESRC_EXTN_QUAL
param.documentation: ExternalNav may be used if quality is above this threshold

param.name: ESRC_FLOW_THRESH
param.documentation: OpticalFlow may be used if innovations are below this threshold

param.name: ESRC_FLOW_QUAL
param.documentation: OpticalFlow may be used if quality is above this threshold

param.name: ESRC_RNGFND_MAX
param.documentation: OpticalFlow may be used if rangefinder distance is below this threshold

param.name: SLUP_ENABLE
param.documentation: Slung Payload enable

param.name: SLUP_VEL_P
param.documentation: Slung Payload Velocity P gain, higher values will result in faster movements in sync with payload

param.name: SLUP_DIST_MAX
param.documentation: Oscillation is suppressed when vehicle and payload are no more than this distance horizontally. Set to 0 to always suppress

param.name: SLUP_SYSID
param.documentation: Slung Payload mavlink system id. 0 to use any/all system ids

param.humanName: Slung Payload return to WP position P gain
param.name: SLUP_WP_POS_P
param.documentation: WP position P gain. higher values will result in vehicle moving more quickly back to the original waypoint

param.humanName: Slung Payload resting offset estimate filter time constant
param.name: SLUP_RESTOFS_TC
param.documentation: payload's position estimator's time constant used to compensate for GPS errors and wind. Higher values result in smoother estimate but slower response

param.name: SLUP_DEBUG
param.documentation: Slung payload debug output, set to 1 to enable debug

param.name: SHIP_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable ship landing system

param.name: SHIP_LAND_ANGLE
param.documentation: Angle from the stern of the ship for landing approach. Use this to ensure that on a go-around that ship superstructure and cables are avoided. A value of zero means to approach from the rear of the ship. A value of 90 means the landing will approach from the port (left) side of the ship. A value of -90 will mean approaching from the starboard (right) side of the ship. A value of 180 will approach from the bow of the ship. This parameter is combined with the sign of the RTL_RADIUS parameter to determine the holdoff pattern. If RTL_RADIUS is positive then a clockwise loiter is performed, if RTL_RADIUS is negative then a counter-clockwise loiter is used.

param.name: SHIP_AUTO_OFS
param.documentation: Settings this parameter to one triggers an automatic follow offset calculation based on current position of the vehicle and the landing target. NOTE: This parameter will auto-reset to zero once the offset has been calculated.

param.name: RK9_FORCEHL
param.documentation: Automatically enables High Latency mode if not already enabled

param.name: RK9_PERIOD
param.documentation: When in High Latency mode, send Rockblock updates every N seconds

param.name: RK9_DEBUG
param.documentation: Sends Rockblock debug text to GCS via statustexts

param.name: RK9_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enables the Rockblock sending and recieving

param.humanName: GCS timeout to start sendin Rockblock messages
param.name: RK9_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: If RK9_FORCEHL=2, this is the number of seconds of GCS timeout until High Latency mode is auto-enabled

param.name: RK9_SERPORT
param.documentation: Serial port number to which the Rockblock is connected.This is the index of the SERIALn_ ports that are set to 28 for "scripting"

param.name: RK9_SCRPORT
param.documentation: Scripting Serial port number to which the Rockblock is connected for HL2 messages This is the index of the SCR_SDEV ports that are set to 2 for "MavlinkHL"

param.name: RK9_RELAY
param.documentation: RELAYn output to control Rockblock power. This connects to I_EN on the Rockblock header.

param.name: RK9_BOOTED
param.documentation: SERVOn GPIO channel that reads the Rockblock booted state. This connects to I_BTD on the Rockblock header. Requires SERVON_FUNCTION=-1

param.name: PARAM_SET_ENABLE
param.documentation: Param Set enable

param.name: AHRS_ORIG_LAT
param.documentation: AHRS/EKF origin will be set to this latitude if not already set

param.name: AHRS_ORIG_LON
param.documentation: AHRS/EKF origin will be set to this longitude if not already set

param.name: AHRS_ORIG_ALT
param.documentation: AHRS/EKF origin will be set to this altitude (in meters above sea level) if not already set

param.name: WEB_ENABLE
param.documentation: enable web server

param.name: WEB_BIND_PORT
param.documentation: web server TCP port

param.name: WEB_DEBUG
param.documentation: web server debugging

param.name: WEB_BLOCK_SIZE
param.documentation: web server block size for download

param.name: WEB_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: timeout for inactive connections

param.humanName: web server minimum file size for sendfile
param.name: WEB_SENDFILE_MIN
param.documentation: sendfile is an offloading mechanism for faster file download. If this is non-zero and the file is larger than this size then sendfile will be used for file download

param.name: CGA_RATIO
param.documentation: The ratio between the front and back motor outputs during steady-state hover. Positive when the CoG is in front of the motors midpoint (front motors work harder).

param.name: PREV_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable parameter reversion system

param.name: PREV_RC_FUNC
param.documentation: RCn_OPTION number to used to trigger parameter reversion

param.name: TA_ACT_FN
param.documentation: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for Terrain Avoidance enable/disable

param.name: TA_PTCH_DWN_MIN
param.documentation: If the downward distance is less than this value then start Pitching up to gain altitude.

param.name: TA_PTCH_FWD_MIN
param.documentation: If the farwardward distance is less than this value then start Pitching up to gain altitude.

param.name: TA_QUAD_DWN_MIN
param.documentation: If the downward distance is less than this value then start Quading up to gain altitude.

param.name: TA_QUAD_FWD_MIN
param.documentation: If the farwardward distance is less than this value then start Quading up to gain altitude.

param.name: TA_PTCH_GSP_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum Groundspeed (not airspeed) to be flying for Pitching to be used.

param.name: TA_PTCH_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: Minimum down or forward distance must be triggered for more than this many seconds to start Pitching

param.name: TA_HOME_DIST
param.documentation: Terrain avoidance will not be applied if the vehicle is less than this distance from home

param.name: TA_ALT_MAX
param.documentation: This is a limit on how high the terrain avoidane will take the vehicle. It acts a failsafe to prevent vertical flyaways.

param.name: TA_GSP_MAX
param.documentation: This is a limit on how fast in groundspeeed terrain avoidance will take the vehicle. This is to allow for reliable sensor readings. -1 for disabled.

param.name: TA_GSP_AIRBRAKE
param.documentation: This is the limit for triggering airbrake to slow groundspeed as a difference between the airspeed and groundspeed. -1 for disabled.

param.name: TA_CMTC_HGT
param.documentation: The minimum Height above terrain to maintain when following an AUTO mission or RTL. If zero(0) use TA_PTCH_DOW_MIN.

param.name: TA_CMTC_ENABLE
param.documentation: Whether to enable Can't Make That Climb while running Terrain Avoidance

param.name: TA_UPDATE_RATE
param.documentation: Avoidance processing rate

param.name: TA_CMTC_RAD
param.documentation: Use this radius for the loiter when trying to gain altitude. If not set or <=0 use WP_LOITER_RAD

param.name: VID1_CAMMODEL
param.documentation: Video stream camera model

param.name: VID1_ID
param.documentation: Video stream id

param.name: VID1_TYPE
param.documentation: Video stream type

param.name: VID1_FLAG
param.documentation: Video stream flags

param.name: VID1_FRAME_RATE
param.documentation: Video stream frame rate

param.name: VID1_HRES
param.documentation: Video stream horizontal resolution

param.name: VID1_VRES
param.documentation: Video stream vertical resolution

param.name: VID1_BITRATE
param.documentation: Video stream bitrate

param.name: VID1_HFOV
param.documentation: Video stream horizontal FOV

param.name: VID1_ENCODING
param.documentation: Video stream encoding

param.name: VID1_IPADDR0
param.documentation: Video stream IP Address first octet

param.name: VID1_IPADDR1
param.documentation: Video stream IP Address second octet

param.name: VID1_IPADDR2
param.documentation: Video stream IP Address third octet

param.name: VID1_IPADDR3
param.documentation: Video stream IP Address fourth octet

param.humanName: Camera1 Video Stream IP Address Port
param.name: VID1_IPPORT
param.documentation: Video stream IP Address Port

param.name: BTAG_ENABLE
param.documentation: enable battery info support

param.name: BTAG_MAX_CYCLES
param.documentation: max battery cycles for arming

param.name: BTAG_CUR_CYCLES
param.documentation: this is the highest value for battery cycles for all connected batteries

param.name: THR_KILL_FUNC
param.documentation: AUX function to kill engine. This can be activated either with a RCn_OPTION and a R/C switch or with a ground station auxilliary function

param.name: THR_KILL_PWM
param.documentation: PWM on kill active

param.humanName: output channel to change on throttle kill
param.name: THR_KILL_CHAN
param.documentation: output channel to change on throttle kill, a value of zero disables the feature

param.name: THR_KILL_VAL
param.documentation: auxilliary value to kill throttle. Set to 2 to kill the throttle when the auxilliary is high. Set to 0 to kill when auxilliary is low

param.name: THR_KILL_DEF
param.documentation: throttle kill default value. The default auxilliary function position on boot

param.name: RCK_FORCEHL
param.documentation: Automatically enables High Latency mode if not already enabled

param.name: RCK_PERIOD
param.documentation: When in High Latency mode, send Rockblock updates every N seconds

param.name: RCK_DEBUG
param.documentation: Sends Rockblock debug text to GCS via statustexts

param.name: RCK_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enables the Rockblock sending and recieving

param.humanName: GCS timeout to start sendin Rockblock messages
param.name: RCK_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: If RCK_FORCEHL=2, this is the number of seconds of GCS timeout until High Latency mode is auto-enabled

param.name: FOLT_ENABLE
param.documentation: Follow Target Send Enable

param.name: FOLT_MAV_CHAN
param.documentation: MAVLink channel to which FOLLOW_TARGET should be sent

param.name: PLND_ALT_CUTOFF
param.documentation: The altitude (rangefinder distance) below which we stop using the precision landing sensor and continue landing

param.name: DIST_CUTOFF
param.documentation: The distance from target beyond which the target is ignored

param.name: RTUN_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable quicktune system

param.name: RTUN_AXES
param.documentation: axes to tune

param.humanName: Rover Quicktune Steering Rate FeedForward ratio
param.name: RTUN_STR_FFRATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between measured response and FF gain. Raise this to get a higher FF gain

param.humanName: Rover Quicktune Steering FF to P ratio
param.name: RTUN_STR_P_RATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between steering FF and P gains. Raise this to get a higher P gain, 0 to leave P unchanged

param.humanName: Rover Quicktune Steering FF to I ratio
param.name: RTUN_STR_I_RATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between steering FF and I gains. Raise this to get a higher I gain, 0 to leave I unchanged

param.name: RTUN_SPD_FFRATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between measured response and CRUISE_THROTTLE value. Raise this to get a higher CRUISE_THROTTLE value

param.humanName: Rover Quicktune Speed FF to P ratio
param.name: RTUN_SPD_P_RATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between speed FF and P gain. Raise this to get a higher P gain, 0 to leave P unchanged

param.humanName: Rover Quicktune Speed FF to I ratio
param.name: RTUN_SPD_I_RATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between speed FF and I gain. Raise this to get a higher I gain, 0 to leave I unchanged

param.name: RTUN_AUTO_FILTER
param.documentation: When enabled the PID filter settings are automatically set based on INS_GYRO_FILTER

param.name: RTUN_AUTO_SAVE
param.documentation: Number of seconds after completion of tune to auto-save. This is useful when using a 2 position switch for quicktune

param.name: RTUN_RC_FUNC
param.documentation: RCn_OPTION number to use to control tuning stop/start/save

param.humanName: Rover Quicktune minimum speed for tuning
param.name: RTUN_SPEED_MIN
param.documentation: The mimimum speed in m/s required for tuning to start

param.name: WINCH_RATE_UP
param.documentation: Maximum rate when retracting line

param.name: WINCH_RATE_DN
param.documentation: Maximum rate when releasing line

param.name: WINCH_RC_FUNC
param.documentation: RCn_OPTION number to use to control winch rate

param.name: AEROM_ANG_ACCEL
param.documentation: Maximum angular acceleration in maneuvers

param.name: AEROM_ANG_TC
param.documentation: This is the time over which we filter the desired roll to smooth it

param.name: AEROM_THR_PIT_FF
param.documentation: This controls how much extra throttle to add based on pitch ange. The value is for 90 degrees and is applied in proportion to pitch

param.name: AEROM_SPD_P
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly the throttle is raised to compensate for a speed error

param.name: AEROM_SPD_I
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly the throttle is raised to compensate for a speed error

param.name: AEROM_ROL_COR_TC
param.documentation: This is the time constant for correcting roll errors. A smaller value leads to faster roll corrections

param.humanName: Time constant for correction of our distance along the path
param.name: AEROM_TIME_COR_P
param.documentation: This is the time constant for correcting path position errors

param.humanName: P gain for path error corrections
param.name: AEROM_ERR_COR_P
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly we correct back onto the desired path

param.humanName: D gain for path error corrections
param.name: AEROM_ERR_COR_D
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly we correct back onto the desired path

param.humanName: The roll rate to use when entering a roll maneuver
param.name: AEROM_ENTRY_RATE
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly we roll into a new orientation

param.name: AEROM_THR_LKAHD
param.documentation: This controls how far ahead we look in time along the path for the target throttle

param.name: AEROM_DEBUG
param.documentation: This controls the printing of extra debug information on paths

param.name: AEROM_THR_MIN
param.documentation: Lowest throttle used during maneuvers

param.name: AEROM_THR_BOOST
param.documentation: This is the extra throttle added in schedule elements marked as needing a throttle boost

param.name: AEROM_YAW_ACCEL
param.documentation: This is maximum yaw acceleration to use

param.name: AEROM_LKAHD
param.documentation: This is how much time to look ahead in the path for calculating path rates

param.name: AEROM_PATH_SCALE
param.documentation: Scale factor for Path/Box size. 0.5 would half the distances in maneuvers. Radii are unaffected.

param.name: AEROM_BOX_WIDTH
param.documentation: Length of aerobatic "box"

param.name: AEROM_STALL_THR
param.documentation: Amount of throttle to reduce to for a stall turn

param.name: AEROM_STALL_PIT
param.documentation: Pitch threashold for moving to final stage of stall turn

param.name: AEROM_KE_RUDD
param.documentation: Percent of rudder normally uses to sustain knife-edge at trick speed

param.name: AEROM_KE_RUDD_LK
param.documentation: Time to look ahead in the path to calculate rudder correction for bank angle

param.name: AEROM_ALT_ABORT
param.documentation: Maximum allowable loss in altitude during a trick or sequence from its starting altitude.

param.name: AEROM_TS_P
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly two aircraft are brought back into time sync

param.name: AEROM_TS_I
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly two aircraft are brought back into time sync

param.name: AEROM_TS_SPDMAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum speed adjustment for time sync between aircraft

param.humanName: Timesync rate of send of NAMED_VALUE_FLOAT data
param.name: AEROM_TS_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the rate we send data for time sync between aircraft

param.name: AEROM_MIS_ANGLE
param.documentation: When set to a non-zero value, this is the assumed direction of the mission. Otherwise the waypoint angle is used

param.name: AEROM_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Options to control aerobatic behavior

param.name: TRIK_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enables Tricks on Switch. TRIK params hidden until enabled

param.name: TRIK_SEL_FN
param.documentation: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for trick selection

param.name: TRIK_ACT_FN
param.documentation: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for trick action (abort,announce,execute)

param.name: TRIK_COUNT
param.documentation: Number of tricks which can be selected over the range of the trik selection RC channel

param.name: EFI_DLA_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable EFI DLA driver

param.name: EFI_DLA_LPS
param.documentation: EFI DLA litres of fuel per second of injection time

param.name: LTE_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable or disable the LTE modem driver

param.name: LTE_SERPORT
param.documentation: Serial port to use for the LTE modem. This is the index of the SERIALn_ ports that are set to 28 for "scripting"

param.name: LTE_SCRPORT
param.documentation: Scripting Serial port to use for the LTE modem. This is the index of the SCR_SDEV ports that are set to 2 for "MAVLink2"

param.name: LTE_SERVER_IP0
param.documentation: First octet of the server IP address to connect to

param.name: LTE_SERVER_IP1
param.documentation: Second octet of the server IP address to connect to

param.name: LTE_SERVER_IP2
param.documentation: Third octet of the server IP address to connect to

param.name: LTE_SERVER_IP3
param.documentation: Fourth octet of the server IP address to connect to

param.name: LTE_SERVER_PORT
param.documentation: IPv4 Port of the server to connect to

param.name: LTE_BAUD
param.documentation: Baud rate for the serial port to the LTE modem when connected. Initial power on baudrate is in LTE_IBAUD

param.name: LTE_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: Timeout in seconds for the LTE connection. If no data is received for this time, the connection will be reset. A value of zero disables the timeout

param.name: LTE_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: The protocol that we will use in communication with the LTE modem. If this is PPP then the LTE_SERVER parameters are not used and instead a PPP connection will be established and you should use the NET_ parameters to enable network ports. If this is MAVLink2 then the LTE_SERVER parameters are used to create a TCP or UDP connection to a single server.

param.name: LTE_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Options to control the LTE modem driver. If VerboseSignalInfoGCS is set then additional NAMED_VALUE_FLOAT values are sent with verbose signal information

param.name: LTE_IBAUD
param.documentation: This is the initial baud rate on power on for the modem. This is set in the modem with the AT+IREX=baud command

param.name: LTE_MCCMNC
param.documentation: This allows selection of network operator

param.name: LTE_TX_RATE
param.documentation: Maximum data transmit rate to the modem in bytes/second. Use zero for unlimited

param.name: LTE_BAND
param.documentation: This allows selection of LTE band. A value of -1 means no band setting change is made. A value of 0 sets all bands. Otherwise the specified band is set.

param.name: ESC_HW_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable Hobbywing ESC telemetry

param.name: ESC_HW_POLES
param.documentation: Number of motor poles for eRPM scaling

param.name: ESC_HW_OFS
param.documentation: Motor number offset of first ESC

param.name: EFI_HFE_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable HFE EFI driver

param.name: EFI_HFE_RATE_HZ
param.documentation: HFI EFI Update rate

param.name: EFI_HFE_ECU_IDX
param.documentation: HFI EFI ECU index, 0 for automatic

param.name: EFI_HFE_FUEL_DTY
param.documentation: HFI EFI fuel density in gram per litre

param.name: EFI_HFE_REL_IDX
param.documentation: HFI EFI relay index

param.name: EFI_HFE_CANDRV
param.documentation: HFI EFI CAN driver

param.name: EFI_HFE_OPTIONS
param.documentation: HFI EFI options

param.name: EFI_H6K_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable Halo6000 EFI driver

param.name: EFI_H6K_CANDRV
param.documentation: Halo6000 CAN driver. Use 1 for first CAN scripting driver, 2 for 2nd driver

param.name: EFI_H6K_START_FN
param.documentation: The RC auxilliary function number for start/stop of the generator. Zero to disable start function

param.name: EFI_H6K_TELEM_RT
param.documentation: The rate that additional generator telemetry is sent

param.name: EFI_H6K_FUELTOT
param.documentation: The capacity of the tank in litres

param.name: EFI_H6K_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Halo6000 options

param.name: UM_SERVO_MASK
param.documentation: Mask of UltraMotion servos

param.name: UM_CANDRV
param.documentation: Set CAN driver

param.name: UM_RATE_HZ
param.documentation: Update rate for UltraMotion servos

param.name: UM_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Optional settings

param.name: EFI_SP_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable SkyPower EFI support

param.name: EFI_SP_CANDRV
param.documentation: Set SkyPower EFI CAN driver

param.name: EFI_SP_UPDATE_HZ
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI update rate

param.name: EFI_SP_THR_FN
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI throttle function. This sets which SERVOn_FUNCTION to use for the target throttle. This should be 70 for fixed wing aircraft and 31 for helicopter rotor speed control

param.name: EFI_SP_THR_RATE
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI throttle rate. This sets rate at which throttle updates are sent to the engine

param.name: EFI_SP_START_FN
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI start function. This is the RCn_OPTION value to use to find the R/C channel used for controlling engine start

param.name: EFI_SP_GEN_FN
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI generator control function. This is the RCn_OPTION value to use to find the R/C channel used for controlling generator start/stop

param.name: EFI_SP_MIN_RPM
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI minimum RPM. This is the RPM below which the engine is considered to be stopped

param.name: EFI_SP_TLM_RT
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI telemetry rate. This is the rate at which extra telemetry values are sent to the GCS

param.name: EFI_SP_LOG_RT
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI log rate. This is the rate at which extra logging of the SkyPower EFI is performed

param.name: EFI_SP_ST_DISARM
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI allow start disarmed. This controls if starting the engine while disarmed is allowed

param.name: EFI_SP_MODEL
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI ECU model

param.name: EFI_SP_GEN_CTRL
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI enable generator control

param.name: EFI_SP_RST_TIME
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI restart time. If engine should be running and it has stopped for this amount of time then auto-restart. To disable this feature set this value to zero.

param.name: EFI_2K_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable NMEA 2000 EFI driver

param.name: EFI_2K_CANDRV
param.documentation: NMEA 2000 CAN driver. Use 1 for first CAN scripting driver, 2 for 2nd driver

param.name: EFI_2K_OPTIONS
param.documentation: NMEA 2000 driver options

param.name: EFI_DLA64_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable EFI DLA64 driver

param.name: TRQL_ENABLE
param.documentation: Torqeedo TorqLink Enable

param.name: TRQL_DEBUG
param.documentation: Torqeedo TorqLink Debug Level

param.name: EFI_SVF_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable SVFFI generator support

param.name: EFI_SVF_ARMCHECK
param.documentation: Check for Generator ARM state before arming

param.name: BATT_ANX_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable ANX battery support

param.name: BATT_ANX_CANDRV
param.documentation: Set ANX CAN driver

param.name: BATT_ANX_INDEX
param.documentation: ANX CAN battery index

param.name: BATT_ANX_OPTIONS
param.documentation: ANX CAN battery options

param.name: ENABLE
param.documentation: When set to 0 this script will not run. When set to 1 this script will run.

param.name: BATT_IDX
param.documentation: Ensure this battery is configured with `BATT*_MONITOR=29`.

param.name: CFACT
param.documentation: This is multiplicative factor to correct the measured flow. Set to <1 if your sensor measures too high.

param.name: MODE
param.documentation: 0: The sensor will save the fuel consumption across power resets. 1: The sensor will reset the power consumption.

param.name: PORT
param.documentation: Which Scripting serial port the sensor is connected at.

param.name: DJIR_DEBUG
param.documentation: Enable DJIRS2 debug

param.name: DJIR_UPSIDEDOWN
param.documentation: DJIRS2 upside down

param.name: EFI_INF_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable EFI INF-Inject driver

param.name: EFI_INF_OPTIONS
param.documentation: EFI INF driver options

param.name: EFI_INF_THR_HZ
param.documentation: EFI INF throttle output rate

param.name: EFI_INF_IGN_AUX
param.documentation: EFI INF throttle ignition aux function

param.humanName: TOFSENSE-M to be used as Proximity sensor
param.name: TOFSENSE_S1_PRX
param.documentation: Set 0 if sensor is to be used as a 1-D rangefinder (minimum of all distances will be sent, typically used for height detection). Set 1 if it should be used as a 3-D proximity device (Eg. Obstacle Avoidance)

param.name: TOFSENSE_S1_SP
param.documentation: UART instance sensor is connected to. Set 1 if sensor is connected to the port with fist SERIALx_PROTOCOL = 28.

param.name: TOFSENSE_S1_BR
param.documentation: Serial Port baud rate. Sensor baud rate can be changed from Nassistant software

param.humanName: TOFSENSE-M to be used as Proximity sensor
param.name: TOFSENSE_PRX
param.documentation: Set 0 if sensor is to be used as a 1-D rangefinder (minimum of all distances will be sent, typically used for height detection). Set 1 if it should be used as a 3-D proximity device (Eg. Obstacle Avoidance)

param.name: TOFSENSE_NO
param.documentation: Number of TOFSENSE-M CAN sensors connected

param.name: TOFSENSE_MODE
param.documentation: TOFSENSE-M mode to be used. 0 for 8x8 mode. 1 for 4x4 mode

param.name: TOFSENSE_INST1
param.documentation: First TOFSENSE-M sensors backend Instance. Setting this to 1 will pick the first backend from PRX_ or RNG_ Parameters (Depending on TOFSENSE_PRX)

param.name: TOFSENSE_ID1
param.documentation: First TOFSENSE-M sensor ID. Leave this at 0 to accept all IDs and if only one sensor is present. You can change ID of sensor from NAssistant Software

param.name: TOFSENSE_INST2
param.documentation: Second TOFSENSE-M sensors backend Instance. Setting this to 2 will pick the second backend from PRX_ or RNG_ Parameters (Depending on TOFSENSE_PRX)

param.name: TOFSENSE_ID2
param.documentation: Second TOFSENSE-M sensor ID. This cannot be 0. You can change ID of sensor from NAssistant Software

param.name: TOFSENSE_INST3
param.documentation: Third TOFSENSE-M sensors backend Instance. Setting this to 3 will pick the second backend from PRX_ or RNG_ Parameters (Depending on TOFSENSE_PRX)

param.name: TOFSENSE_ID3
param.documentation: Third TOFSENSE-M sensor ID. This cannot be 0. You can change ID of sensor from NAssistant Software

param.name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

param.humanName: AHRS use GPS for DCM navigation and position-down
param.name: AHRS_GPS_USE
param.documentation: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight. Currently this affects only the DCM-based AHRS: the EKF uses GPS according to its own parameters. A value of 2 means to use GPS for height as well as position - both in DCM estimation and when determining altitude-above-home.

values.value: Use GPS for DCM position and height

param.name: AHRS_YAW_P
param.documentation: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

param.name: AHRS_RP_P
param.documentation: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

param.name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor by clipping it to groundspeed plus/minus this limit. See ARSPD_OPTIONS and ARSPD_WIND_MAX to disable airspeed sensors.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_X
param.documentation: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Y
param.documentation: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Z
param.documentation: Not Used

param.name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
param.documentation: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle. Firmware versions 4.2 and prior can use a CUSTOM (100) rotation to set the AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles for AHRS orientation. Later versions provide two general custom rotations which can be used, Custom 1 and Custom 2, with CUST_ROT1_ROLL/PIT/YAW or CUST_ROT2_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles.

param.humanName: AHRS Velocity Complementary Filter Beta Coefficient
param.name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
param.documentation: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_MINSATS
param.documentation: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

param.humanName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation
param.name: AHRS_EKF_TYPE
param.documentation: This controls which NavEKF Kalman filter version is used for attitude and position estimation

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_PIT
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_YAW
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: AHRS_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This controls optional AHRS behaviour. Setting DisableDCMFallbackFW will change the AHRS behaviour for fixed wing aircraft in fly-forward flight to not fall back to DCM when the EKF stops navigating. Setting DisableDCMFallbackVTOL will change the AHRS behaviour for fixed wing aircraft in non fly-forward (VTOL) flight to not fall back to DCM when the EKF stops navigating. Setting DontDisableAirspeedUsingEKF disables the EKF based innovation check for airspeed consistency

param.name: AIS_TYPE
param.documentation: AIS receiver type

param.name: AIS_LIST_MAX
param.documentation: AIS list size of nearest vessels. Longer lists take longer to refresh with lower SRx_ADSB values.

param.name: AIS_TIME_OUT
param.documentation: if no updates are received in this time a vessel will be removed from the list

param.name: AIS_LOGGING
param.documentation: Bitmask of AIS logging options
param.field: 0:Log all AIVDM messages,1:Log only unsupported AIVDM messages,2:Log decoded messages

param.name: ARMING_ACCTHRESH
param.documentation: Accelerometer error threshold used to determine inconsistent accelerometers. Compares this error range to other accelerometers to detect a hardware or calibration error. Lower value means tighter check and harder to pass arming check. Not all accelerometers are created equal.

param.name: ARMING_RUDDER
param.documentation: Allow arm/disarm by rudder input. When enabled arming can be done with right rudder, disarming with left rudder. Rudder arming only works with throttle at zero +- deadzone (RCx_DZ). Depending on vehicle type, arming in certain modes is prevented. See the wiki for each vehicle. Caution is recommended when arming if it is allowed in an auto-throttle mode!

param.name: ARMING_MIS_ITEMS
param.documentation: Bitmask of mission items that are required to be planned in order to arm the aircraft

param.name: ARMING_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Options that can be applied to change arming behaviour

bitmask.bit: Do not send status text on state change
Skip IMU consistency checks when ICE motor running

param.field: 0:Disable prearm display,1:Do not send status text on state change,2:Skip IMU consistency checks when ICE motor running

param.humanName: Compass magnetic field strength error threshold vs earth magnetic model
param.name: ARMING_MAGTHRESH
param.documentation: Compass magnetic field strength error threshold vs earth magnetic model. X and y axis are compared using this threhold, Z axis uses 2x this threshold. 0 to disable check

param.name: ARMING_CRSDP_IGN
param.documentation: Must have value "1" if crashdump data is present on the system, or a prearm failure will be raised. Do not set this parameter unless the risks of doing so are fully understood. The presence of a crash dump means that the firmware currently installed has suffered a critical software failure which resulted in the autopilot immediately rebooting. The crashdump file gives diagnostic information which can help in finding the issue, please contact the ArduPIlot support team. If this crashdump data is present, the vehicle is likely unsafe to fly. Check the ArduPilot documentation for more details.

param.name: ARMING_SKIPCHK
param.documentation: Checks to skip prior to arming motor. This is a bitmask of checks before allowing arming that will be skipped. For most users it is recommended to leave this at the default of 0 (no checks skipped). In extreme circumstances, a value of -1 can be used to skip all non-mandatory current and future checks.
param.field: 1:Barometer,2:Compass,3:GPS lock,4:INS,5:Parameters,6:RC Channels,7:Board voltage,8:Battery Level,10:Logging Available,11:Hardware safety switch,12:GPS Configuration,13:System,14:Mission,15:Rangefinder,16:Camera,17:AuxAuth,18:VisualOdometry,19:FFT

param.name: ARSPD_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable airspeed sensor support

param.name: ARSPD_TUBE_ORDER
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

param.name: ARSPD_PRIMARY
param.documentation: This selects which airspeed sensor will be the primary if multiple sensors are found

param.name: ARSPD_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

param.humanName: Maximum airspeed and ground speed difference
param.name: ARSPD_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

param.humanName: Airspeed and GPS speed difference that gives a warning
param.name: ARSPD_WIND_WARN
param.documentation: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

param.name: ARSPD_WIND_GATE
param.documentation: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle.

param.name: ARSPD2_TYPE
param.documentation: Type of airspeed sensor

param.name: ARSPD2_USE
param.documentation: This parameter is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

param.name: ARSPD2_OFFSET
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration offset

param.name: ARSPD2_RATIO
param.documentation: Calibrates pitot tube pressure to velocity. Increasing this value will indicate a higher airspeed at any given dynamic pressure.

param.name: ARSPD2_PIN
param.documentation: The pin number that the airspeed sensor is connected to for analog sensors. Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.humanName: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.
param.name: ARSPD2_AUTOCAL
param.documentation: Enables automatic adjustment of airspeed ratio during a calibration flight based on estimation of ground speed and true airspeed. New ratio saved every 2 minutes if change is > 5%. Should not be left enabled.

param.name: ARSPD2_TUBE_ORDR
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

param.humanName: Skip airspeed offset calibration on startup
param.name: ARSPD2_SKIP_CAL
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration or requiring a manual calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.

values.value: Do not require offset calibration before flight. Manual calibration should be performed during initial setup.
Do not calibrate on start up. Manual calibration must be performed once per boot.

param.humanName: The PSI range of the device
param.name: ARSPD2_PSI_RANGE
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device

param.name: ARSPD2_BUS
param.documentation: Bus number of the I2C bus where the airspeed sensor is connected. May not correspond to board's I2C bus number labels. Retry another bus and reboot if airspeed sensor fails to initialize.

param.name: ARSPD2_DEVID
param.documentation: Airspeed sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: ARSPD3_TYPE
param.documentation: Type of airspeed sensor

param.name: ARSPD3_USE
param.documentation: This parameter is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

param.name: ARSPD3_OFFSET

param.name: ARSPD3_RATIO

param.name: ARSPD_DEVID
param.documentation: Airspeed sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO1_GND_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: BARO_GND_TEMP
param.documentation: User provided ambient ground temperature in degrees Celsius. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. A value of 0 means use the internal measurement ambient temperature.

param.name: BARO_ALT_OFFSET
param.documentation: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

param.name: BARO_PRIMARY
param.documentation: This selects which barometer will be the primary if multiple barometers are found

param.name: BARO_EXT_BUS
param.documentation: This selects the bus number for looking for an I2C barometer. When set to -1 it will probe all external i2c buses based on the BARO_PROBE_EXT parameter.

param.name: BARO2_GND_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: BARO3_GND_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.humanName: Range in which sample is accepted
param.name: BARO_FLTR_RNG
param.documentation: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.

param.name: BARO_PROBE_EXT
param.documentation: This sets which types of external i2c barometer to look for. It is a bitmask of barometer types. The I2C buses to probe is based on BARO_EXT_BUS. If BARO_EXT_BUS is -1 then it will probe all external buses, otherwise it will probe just the bus number given in BARO_EXT_BUS.

param.name: BARO1_DEVID
param.documentation: Barometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO2_DEVID
param.documentation: Barometer2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO3_DEVID
param.documentation: Barometer3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO_FIELD_ELV
param.documentation: User provided field elevation in meters. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. Changes to this parameter will only be used when disarmed. A value of 0 means the EKF origin height is used for takeoff height above sea level.

param.name: BARO_ALTERR_MAX
param.documentation: This is the maximum acceptable altitude discrepancy between GPS altitude and barometric presssure altitude calculated against a standard atmosphere for arming checks to pass. If you are getting an arming error due to this parameter then you may have a faulty or substituted barometer. A common issue is vendors replacing a MS5611 in a "Pixhawk" with a MS5607. If you have that issue then please see BARO_OPTIONS parameter to force the MS5611 to be treated as a MS5607. This check is disabled if the value is zero.

param.name: BARO_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Barometer options

param.name: BARO1_THST_SCALE
param.documentation: Thrust scaling in Pascals. This value scaled by the normalized thrust is subtracted from the barometer pressure. This is used to adjust linearly based on the thrust output for local pressure difference induced by the props.

param.name: BARO1_WCF_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_FWD
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_BCK
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Y direction (right)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_RGT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_LFT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Z direction (up)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_UP
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during climbing flight (or forward flight with a high forwards lean angle), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Z direction (down)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_DN
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during descending flight (or forward flight with a high backwards lean angle, eg braking manoeuvre), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.name: BARO2_WCF_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)
param.name: BARO2_WCF_FWD
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)
param.name: BARO2_WCF_BCK
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Y direction (right)
param.name: BARO2_WCF_RGT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)
param.name: BARO2_WCF_LFT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Z direction (up)
param.name: BARO2_WCF_UP
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during climbing flight (or forward flight with a high forwards lean angle), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Z direction (down)

param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during descending flight (or forward flight with a high backwards lean angle, eg braking manoeuvre), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.name: BARO3_WCF_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)
param.name: BARO3_WCF_FWD
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during climbing flight (or forward flight with a high forwards lean angle), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
