param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during descending flight (or forward flight with a high backwards lean angle, eg braking manoeuvre), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.name: BATT2_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT2_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT2_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATT2_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATT2_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATT2_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

param.name: BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATT2_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT2_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT2_ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

bitmask.bit: MPPT reports input voltage and current
Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average
Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS, 7:Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node, 8:Battery is for internal autopilot use only, 9:Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average, 10:Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.humanName: ESC Telemetry Index to write to
param.name: BATT2_ESC_INDEX
param.documentation: ESC Telemetry Index to write voltage, current, consumption and temperature data to. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: BATT2_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATT2_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATT2_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT2_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT2_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17. For Synthetic Current sensor monitors, this is the maximum, full throttle current draw.

param.name: BATT2_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor for Analog Sensors. For Synthetic Current sensor, this offset is the zero throttle system current and is added to the calculated throttle base current.

param.name: BATT2_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied.

param.name: BATT2_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT2_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATT2_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATT2_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATT2_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT2_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT2_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATT2_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATT2_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT2_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT2_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT2_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT2_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATT2_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT2_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT2_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT2_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT2_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.name: BATT2_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT2_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT2_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT2_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT2_CHANNEL
param.documentation: INA3221 channel to return data for

param.humanName: Battery Voltage sensing pin on the AD7091R5 Ic
param.name: BATT2_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATT2_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for Current monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATT2_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT2_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT).

param.name: BATT2_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to.

param.name: BATT2_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT2_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

param.name: BATT4_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT4_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT4_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17. For Synthetic Current sensor monitors, this is the maximum, full throttle current draw.

param.name: BATT4_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor for Analog Sensors. For Synthetic Current sensor, this offset is the zero throttle system current and is added to the calculated throttle base current.

param.name: BATT4_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied.

param.name: BATT4_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT4_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATT4_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATT4_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATT4_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT4_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT4_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATT4_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATT4_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT4_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT4_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT4_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT4_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATT4_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT4_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT4_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT4_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT4_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.name: BATT4_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT4_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT4_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT4_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT4_CHANNEL
param.documentation: INA3221 channel to return data for

param.humanName: Battery Voltage sensing pin on the AD7091R5 Ic
param.name: BATT4_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATT4_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for Current monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATT4_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT4_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT).

param.name: BATT4_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to.

param.name: BATT4_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT4_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

param.name: BATT5_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT5_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT5_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATT5_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATT5_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATT5_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT5_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT5_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT5_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT5_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT5_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT5_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT5_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT5_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT5_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT5_FS_LOW_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

param.name: BATT5_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATT5_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT5_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT5_ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT5_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

bitmask.bit: MPPT reports input voltage and current
Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average
Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS, 7:Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node, 8:Battery is for internal autopilot use only, 9:Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average, 10:Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.humanName: ESC Telemetry Index to write to
param.name: BATT5_ESC_INDEX
param.documentation: ESC Telemetry Index to write voltage, current, consumption and temperature data to. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: BATT7_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT7_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT7_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATT7_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATT7_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT7_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT7_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT7_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT7_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATT7_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT7_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT7_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT7_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT7_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.name: BATT7_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT7_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT7_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT7_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT7_CHANNEL
param.documentation: INA3221 channel to return data for

param.humanName: Battery Voltage sensing pin on the AD7091R5 Ic
param.name: BATT7_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATT7_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for Current monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATT7_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT7_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT).

param.name: BATT7_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to.

param.name: BATT7_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT7_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

param.name: BATT8_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT8_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT8_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATT8_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATT8_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATT8_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT8_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT8_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT8_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT8_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT8_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT8_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT8_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT8_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT8_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT8_FS_LOW_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

param.name: BATT8_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATT8_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT8_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT8_ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT8_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

bitmask.bit: MPPT reports input voltage and current
Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average
Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS, 7:Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node, 8:Battery is for internal autopilot use only, 9:Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average, 10:Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.humanName: ESC Telemetry Index to write to
param.name: BATT8_ESC_INDEX
param.documentation: ESC Telemetry Index to write voltage, current, consumption and temperature data to. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: BATT8_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATT8_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATT8_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT8_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT8_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17. For Synthetic Current sensor monitors, this is the maximum, full throttle current draw.

param.name: BATT8_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor for Analog Sensors. For Synthetic Current sensor, this offset is the zero throttle system current and is added to the calculated throttle base current.

param.name: BATT8_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied.

param.name: BATT8_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT8_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATT8_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATT8_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATT8_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT8_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT8_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATT8_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATT8_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT8_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT8_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT8_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT8_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATT8_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT8_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT8_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT8_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT8_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.name: BATT8_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT8_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT8_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT8_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.documentation: INA3221 channel to return data for

param.name: BATTA_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATTA_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATTA_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATTA_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.name: BATTA_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

param.name: BATTA_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATTA_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATTA_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATTA_CHANNEL
param.documentation: INA3221 channel to return data for

param.humanName: Battery Voltage sensing pin on the AD7091R5 Ic
param.name: BATTA_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATTA_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for Current monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATTA_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATTA_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT).

param.name: BATTA_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to.

param.name: BATTA_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATTA_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

param.name: BATTB_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATTB_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATTB_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATTB_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATTB_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATTB_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATTB_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTB_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTB_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTB_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTB_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATTB_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTB_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTB_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTB_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTB_FS_LOW_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

param.name: BATTB_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATTB_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATTB_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATTB_ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATTB_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

bitmask.bit: MPPT reports input voltage and current
Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average
Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS, 7:Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node, 8:Battery is for internal autopilot use only, 9:Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average, 10:Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.humanName: ESC Telemetry Index to write to
param.name: BATTB_ESC_INDEX
param.documentation: ESC Telemetry Index to write voltage, current, consumption and temperature data to. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: BATTB_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATTB_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATTB_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATTB_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATTB_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17. For Synthetic Current sensor monitors, this is the maximum, full throttle current draw.

param.name: BATTB_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor for Analog Sensors. For Synthetic Current sensor, this offset is the zero throttle system current and is added to the calculated throttle base current.

param.name: BATTB_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied.

param.name: BATTB_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATTB_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATTB_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATTB_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATTB_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATTB_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATTB_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATTB_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATTB_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTB_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTB_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTB_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTB_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATTB_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATTB_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATTB_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATTB_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATTB_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.name: BATTB_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

param.name: BATTB_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATTB_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATTB_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATTB_CHANNEL
param.documentation: INA3221 channel to return data for

param.name: BATTE_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATTE_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATTE_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATTE_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATTE_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATTE_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTE_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTE_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTE_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTE_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATTE_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTE_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTE_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTE_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTE_FS_LOW_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

param.name: BATTE_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATTE_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATTE_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATTE_ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATTE_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

bitmask.bit: MPPT reports input voltage and current
Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average
Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS, 7:Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node, 8:Battery is for internal autopilot use only, 9:Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average, 10:Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.humanName: ESC Telemetry Index to write to
param.name: BATTE_ESC_INDEX
param.documentation: ESC Telemetry Index to write voltage, current, consumption and temperature data to. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: BATTE_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATTE_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATTE_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATTE_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATTE_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17. For Synthetic Current sensor monitors, this is the maximum, full throttle current draw.

param.name: BATTE_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor for Analog Sensors. For Synthetic Current sensor, this offset is the zero throttle system current and is added to the calculated throttle base current.

param.name: BATTE_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied.

param.name: BATTE_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATTE_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATTE_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATTE_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATTE_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATTE_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATTE_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATTE_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATTE_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTE_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTE_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTE_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTE_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATTE_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATTE_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATTE_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATTE_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATTE_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.name: BATTE_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

param.name: BATTE_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATTE_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATTE_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATTE_CHANNEL
param.documentation: INA3221 channel to return data for

param.name: BATT_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT_ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

bitmask.bit: MPPT reports input voltage and current
Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average
Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS, 7:Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node, 8:Battery is for internal autopilot use only, 9:Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average, 10:Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.humanName: ESC Telemetry Index to write to
param.name: BATT_ESC_INDEX
param.documentation: ESC Telemetry Index to write voltage, current, consumption and temperature data to. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: BATT_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATT_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATT_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17. For Synthetic Current sensor monitors, this is the maximum, full throttle current draw.

param.name: BATT_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor for Analog Sensors. For Synthetic Current sensor, this offset is the zero throttle system current and is added to the calculated throttle base current.

param.name: BATT_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied.

param.name: BATT_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATT_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATT_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATT_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATT_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATT_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATT_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.name: BATT_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT_CHANNEL
param.documentation: INA3221 channel to return data for

param.humanName: Battery Voltage sensing pin on the AD7091R5 Ic
param.name: BATT_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATT_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for Current monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATT_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT).

param.name: BATT_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to.

param.name: BATT_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

param.name: BRD_SER1_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 1 (telemetry 1). You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup. Note that the PX4v1 does not have hardware flow control pins on this port, so you should leave this disabled.

param.name: BRD_SER2_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 2 (telemetry 2). You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.name: BRD_SER3_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 3. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.name: BRD_SER4_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 4. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.name: BRD_SER5_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 5. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.name: BRD_SER6_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 6. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.name: BRD_SER7_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 7. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.name: BRD_SER8_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 8. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.humanName: Sets default state of the safety switch
param.name: BRD_SAFETY_DEFLT
param.documentation: This controls the default state of the safety switch at startup. When set to 1 the safety switch will start in the safe state (flashing) at boot. When set to zero the safety switch will start in the unsafe state (solid) at startup. Note that if a safety switch is fitted the user can still control the safety state after startup using the switch. The safety state can also be controlled in software using a MAVLink message.

param.name: BRD_SBUS_OUT
param.documentation: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz

param.name: BRD_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: User-defined serial number of this vehicle, it can be any arbitrary number you want and has no effect on the autopilot

param.humanName: Outputs which ignore the safety switch state
param.name: BRD_SAFETY_MASK
param.documentation: A bitmask which controls what outputs can move while the safety switch has not been pressed

param.name: BRD_HEAT_TARG
param.documentation: Board heater target temperature for boards with controllable heating units. Set to -1 to disable the heater, please reboot after setting to -1.

param.name: BRD_TYPE
param.documentation: This allows selection of a PX4 or VRBRAIN board type. If set to zero then the board type is auto-detected (PX4)

param.name: BRD_IO_ENABLE
param.documentation: This allows for the IO co-processor on boards with an IOMCU to be disabled. Setting to 2 will enable the IOMCU but not attempt to update firmware on startup

param.name: BRD_SAFETYOPTION
param.documentation: This controls the activation of the safety button. It allows you to control if the safety button can be used for safety enable and/or disable, and whether the button is only active when disarmed

bitmask.bit: Force safety on when the aircraft disarms

param.field: 0:ActiveForSafetyDisable,1:ActiveForSafetyEnable,2:ActiveWhenArmed,3:Force safety on when the aircraft disarms

param.name: BRD_VBUS_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum voltage on the autopilot power rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

param.name: BRD_VSERVO_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum voltage on the servo rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

param.name: BRD_SD_SLOWDOWN
param.documentation: This is a scaling factor to slow down microSD operation. It can be used on flight board and microSD card combinations where full speed is not reliable. For normal full speed operation a value of 0 should be used.

param.name: BRD_PWM_VOLT_SEL
param.documentation: This sets the voltage max for PWM output pulses. 0 for 3.3V and 1 for 5V output. On boards with an IOMCU that support this parameter this option only affects the 8 main outputs, not the 6 auxiliary outputs. Using 5V output can help to reduce the impact of ESC noise interference corrupting signals to the ESCs.

param.name: BRD_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Board specific option flags

bitmask.bit: Write protect firmware flash on reboot
Write protect bootloader flash on reboot
Disable board arming gpio output change on arm/disarm

param.field: 0:Enable hardware watchdog, 1:Disable MAVftp, 2:Enable set of internal parameters, 3:Enable Debug Pins, 4:Unlock flash on reboot, 5:Write protect firmware flash on reboot, 6:Write protect bootloader flash on reboot, 7:Skip board validation, 8:Disable board arming gpio output change on arm/disarm, 9:Use safety pins as profiled

param.name: BRD_BOOT_DELAY
param.documentation: This adds a delay in milliseconds to boot to ensure peripherals initialise fully

param.name: BRD_HEAT_P
param.documentation: Board Heater P gain

param.name: BRD_HEAT_I
param.documentation: Board Heater integrator gain

param.name: BRD_HEAT_IMAX
param.documentation: Board Heater integrator maximum

param.name: BRD_ALT_CONFIG
param.documentation: Select an alternative hardware configuration. A value of zero selects the default configuration for this board. Other values are board specific. Please see the documentation for your board for details on any alternative configuration values that may be available.

param.name: BRD_HEAT_LOWMGN
param.documentation: Arming check will fail if temp is lower than this margin below BRD_HEAT_TARG. 0 disables the low temperature check

param.name: BRD_SD_MISSION
param.documentation: This sets the amount of storage in kilobytes reserved on the microsd card in mission.stg for waypoint storage. Each waypoint uses 15 bytes.

param.name: BRD_SD_FENCE
param.documentation: This sets the amount of storage in kilobytes reserved on the microsd card in fence.stg for fence storage.

param.name: BRD_IO_DSHOT
param.documentation: This loads the DShot firmware on the IO co-processor

param.humanName: Capture and calculate true CPU load using idle threads
param.name: BRD_IDLE_STATS
param.documentation: Capture and calculate true CPU load using idle threads

param.humanName: Set type of direct attached radio
param.name: BRD_RADIO_TYPE
param.documentation: This enables support for direct attached radio receivers

param.name: BRD_RADIO_PROT
param.documentation: Select air protocol

param.name: BRD_RADIO_DEBUG
param.documentation: radio debug level

param.name: BRD_RADIO_DISCRC
param.documentation: disable receive CRC (for debug)

param.name: BRD_RADIO_SIGCH
param.documentation: Channel to show receive RSSI signal strength, or zero for disabled

param.name: BRD_RADIO_PPSCH
param.documentation: Channel to show received packet-per-second rate, or zero for disabled

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TELEM
param.documentation: If this is non-zero then telemetry packets will be sent over DSM

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TXPOW
param.documentation: Set telemetry transmit power. This is the power level (from 1 to 8) for telemetry packets sent from the RX to the TX

param.humanName: Put radio into FCC test mode
param.name: BRD_RADIO_FCCTST
param.documentation: If this is enabled then the radio will continuously transmit as required for FCC testing. The transmit channel is set by the value of the parameter. The radio will not work for RC input while this is enabled

param.name: BRD_RADIO_STKMD
param.documentation: This selects between different stick input modes. The default is mode2, which has throttle on the left stick and pitch on the right stick. You can instead set mode1, which has throttle on the right stick and pitch on the left stick.

param.humanName: Set radio to factory test channel
param.name: BRD_RADIO_TESTCH
param.documentation: This sets the radio to a fixed test channel for factory testing. Using a fixed channel avoids the need for binding in factory testing.

param.humanName: RSSI value channel for telemetry data on transmitter
param.name: BRD_RADIO_TSIGCH
param.documentation: Channel to show telemetry RSSI value as received by TX

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TPPSCH
param.documentation: Channel to show telemetry packets-per-second value, as received at TX

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TXMAX
param.documentation: Set transmitter maximum transmit power (from 1 to 8)

param.name: BRD_RADIO_BZOFS
param.documentation: Set transmitter buzzer note adjustment (adjust frequency up)

param.name: BRD_RADIO_ABTIME
param.documentation: When non-zero this sets the time with no transmitter packets before we start looking for auto-bind packets.

param.name: BRD_RADIO_ABLVL
param.documentation: This sets the minimum RSSI of an auto-bind packet for it to be accepted. This should be set so that auto-bind will only happen at short range to minimise the change of an auto-bind happening accidentially

param.name: BRD_RTC_TYPES
param.documentation: Specifies which sources of UTC time will be accepted

param.name: BRD_RTC_TZ_MIN
param.documentation: Adds offset in +- minutes from UTC to calculate local time

param.name: CAN_LOGLEVEL
param.documentation: Loglevel for recording initialisation and debug information from CAN Interface

param.humanName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver
param.name: CAN_D1_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

param.humanName: Secondary protocol with 11 bit CAN addressing
param.name: CAN_D1_PROTOCOL2
param.documentation: Secondary protocol with 11 bit CAN addressing

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which ESC (motor) channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_ESC_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of ESC command messages

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which servo channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of servo command messages

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_ECU_ID
param.documentation: Node ID to send ECU throttle messages to. Set to zero to disable ECU throttle messages. Set to 255 to broadcast to all ECUs.

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_ECU_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of ECU command messages

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_NODE
param.documentation: DroneCAN node ID used by the driver itself on this network

param.humanName: Output channels to be transmitted as servo over DroneCAN
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over DroneCAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16, 16: Servo 17, 17: Servo 18, 18: Servo 19, 19: Servo 20, 20: Servo 21, 21: Servo 22, 22: Servo 23, 23: Servo 24, 24: Servo 25, 25: Servo 26, 26: Servo 27, 27: Servo 28, 28: Servo 29, 29: Servo 30, 30: Servo 31, 31: Servo 32

param.humanName: Output channels to be transmitted as ESC over DroneCAN
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over DroneCAN

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_OPTION
param.documentation: Option flags

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_NTF_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for Notify State Message

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_ESC_OF
param.documentation: Offset for ESC numbering in DroneCAN ESC RawCommand messages. This allows for more efficient packing of ESC command messages. If your ESCs are on servo outputs 5 to 8 and you set this parameter to 4 then the ESC RawCommand will be sent with the first 4 slots filled. This can be used for more efficient usage of CAN bandwidth

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_POOL
param.documentation: Amount of memory in bytes to allocate for the DroneCAN memory pool. More memory is needed for higher CAN bus loads

param.humanName: Bitmask for output channels for reversible ESCs over DroneCAN.
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_ESC_RV
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for each output channel that uses a reversible ESC over DroneCAN. Reversible ESCs use both positive and negative values in RawCommands, with positive commanding the forward direction and negative commanding the reverse direction.

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_RLY_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for relay outputs, note that this rate is per message each message does 1 relay, so if with more relays will take longer to update at the same rate, a extra message will be sent when a relay changes state

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_SER_EN
param.documentation: Enable DroneCAN virtual serial ports

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_S1_NOD
param.documentation: CAN remote node number for serial port

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_S1_IDX
param.documentation: Serial port number on remote CAN node

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_S1_BD
param.documentation: Serial baud rate on remote CAN node

param.humanName: Serial protocol of DroneCAN serial port
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_S1_PRO
param.documentation: Serial protocol of DroneCAN serial port

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_S2_NOD
param.documentation: CAN remote node number for serial port

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_S2_IDX
param.documentation: Serial port number on remote CAN node

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_S2_BD
param.documentation: Serial baud rate on remote CAN node

param.humanName: Serial protocol of DroneCAN serial port
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_S2_PRO
param.documentation: Serial protocol of DroneCAN serial port

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_S3_NOD
param.documentation: CAN node number for serial port

param.humanName: Serial port number on remote CAN node
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_S3_IDX
param.documentation: Serial port number on remote CAN node

param.humanName: Serial baud rate on remote CAN node
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_S3_BD
param.documentation: Serial baud rate on remote CAN node

param.humanName: Serial protocol of DroneCAN serial port
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_S3_PRO
param.documentation: Serial protocol of DroneCAN serial port

param.humanName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver
param.name: CAN_D2_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

param.humanName: Secondary protocol with 11 bit CAN addressing
param.name: CAN_D2_PROTOCOL2
param.documentation: Secondary protocol with 11 bit CAN addressing

param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16

param.name: CAN_D2_UC_SRV_BM

param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16, 16: Servo 17, 17: Servo 18, 18: Servo 19, 19: Servo 20, 20: Servo 21, 21: Servo 22, 22: Servo 23, 23: Servo 24, 24: Servo 25, 25: Servo 26, 26: Servo 27, 27: Servo 28, 28: Servo 29, 29: Servo 30, 30: Servo 31, 31: Servo 32

If your ESCs are on servo outputs 5 to 8 and you set this parameter to 4 then the ESC RawCommand will be sent with the first 4 slots filled. param.name: CAN_D2_UC_POOL

param.humanName: Bitmask for output channels for reversible ESCs over DroneCAN.

param.name: CAN_D3_PROTOCOL

param.name: CAN_D3_PROTOCOL2

param.name: CAN_D3_PC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which ESC (motor) channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

param.name: CAN_D3_PC_ESC_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of ESC command messages

param.name: CAN_D3_PC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which servo channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16

param.name: CAN_D3_PC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of servo command messages

param.name: CAN_D3_PC_ECU_ID
param.documentation: Node ID to send ECU throttle messages to. Set to zero to disable ECU throttle messages. Set to 255 to broadcast to all ECUs.

param.name: CAN_D3_PC_ECU_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of ECU command messages

param.name: CAN_D3_UC_NODE
param.documentation: DroneCAN node ID used by the driver itself on this network

param.humanName: Output channels to be transmitted as servo over DroneCAN
param.name: CAN_D3_UC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over DroneCAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16, 16: Servo 17, 17: Servo 18, 18: Servo 19, 19: Servo 20, 20: Servo 21, 21: Servo 22, 22: Servo 23, 23: Servo 24, 24: Servo 25, 25: Servo 26, 26: Servo 27, 27: Servo 28, 28: Servo 29, 29: Servo 30, 30: Servo 31, 31: Servo 32

param.humanName: Output channels to be transmitted as ESC over DroneCAN
param.name: CAN_D3_UC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over DroneCAN

param.name: CAN_D3_UC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

param.name: CAN_D3_UC_OPTION
param.documentation: Option flags

param.name: CAN_D3_UC_NTF_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for Notify State Message

param.name: CAN_D3_UC_ESC_OF
param.documentation: Offset for ESC numbering in DroneCAN ESC RawCommand messages. This allows for more efficient packing of ESC command messages. If your ESCs are on servo outputs 5 to 8 and you set this parameter to 4 then the ESC RawCommand will be sent with the first 4 slots filled. This can be used for more efficient usage of CAN bandwidth

param.name: CAN_D3_UC_POOL
param.documentation: Amount of memory in bytes to allocate for the DroneCAN memory pool. More memory is needed for higher CAN bus loads

param.humanName: Bitmask for output channels for reversible ESCs over DroneCAN.
param.name: CAN_D3_UC_ESC_RV
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for each output channel that uses a reversible ESC over DroneCAN. Reversible ESCs use both positive and negative values in RawCommands, with positive commanding the forward direction and negative commanding the reverse direction.

param.name: CAN_D3_UC_RLY_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for relay outputs, note that this rate is per message each message does 1 relay, so if with more relays will take longer to update at the same rate, a extra message will be sent when a relay changes state

param.name: CAN_D3_UC_SER_EN

param.name: CAN_D3_UC_S1_NOD

param.name: CAN_D3_UC_S1_IDX

param.name: CAN_D3_UC_S1_BD

param.name: CAN_P1_DRIVER
param.documentation: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

param.name: CAN_P1_BITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

param.name: CAN_P1_FDBITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 1000000 to 8000000

param.name: CAN_P1_OPTIONS
param.documentation: CAN per-interface options

param.humanName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface
param.name: CAN_P2_DRIVER
param.documentation: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

param.name: CAN_P2_FDBITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 1000000 to 8000000

param.documentation: CAN per-interface options
