param.name: COMPASS_CAL_FIT
param.documentation: This controls the fitness level required for a successful compass calibration. A lower value makes for a stricter fit (less likely to pass). This is the value used for the primary magnetometer. Other magnetometers get double the value.

param.name: COMPASS_OFFS_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowed compass offset in calibration and arming checks

param.name: COMPASS_DISBLMSK
param.documentation: This is a bitmask of driver types to disable. If a driver type is set in this mask then that driver will not try to find a sensor at startup

param.humanName: Range in which sample is accepted
param.name: COMPASS_FLTR_RNG
param.documentation: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.

param.name: COMPASS_AUTO_ROT
param.documentation: When enabled this will automatically check the orientation of compasses on successful completion of compass calibration. If set to 2 then external compasses will have their orientation automatically corrected.

values.value: use same tolerance to auto rotate 45 deg rotations

param.humanName: Compass device id with 1st order priority
param.name: COMPASS_PRIO1_ID
param.documentation: Compass device id with 1st order priority, set automatically if 0. Reboot required after change.

param.humanName: Compass device id with 2nd order priority
param.name: COMPASS_PRIO2_ID
param.documentation: Compass device id with 2nd order priority, set automatically if 0. Reboot required after change.

param.humanName: Compass device id with 3rd order priority
param.name: COMPASS_PRIO3_ID
param.documentation: Compass device id with 3rd order priority, set automatically if 0. Reboot required after change.

param.name: COMPASS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass. Note that this is separate from COMPASS_USE. This will enable the low level senor, and will enable logging of magnetometer data. To use the compass for navigation you must also set COMPASS_USE to 1.

param.name: COMPASS_SCALE
param.documentation: Scaling factor for first compass to compensate for sensor scaling errors. If this is 0 then no scaling is done

param.name: COMPASS_SCALE2
param.documentation: Scaling factor for 2nd compass to compensate for sensor scaling errors. If this is 0 then no scaling is done

param.name: COMPASS_SCALE3
param.documentation: Scaling factor for 3rd compass to compensate for sensor scaling errors. If this is 0 then no scaling is done

param.name: COMPASS_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the compass

bitmask.bit: Allow missing DroneCAN compasses to be automaticaly replaced (calibration still required)

param.field: 0:CalRequireGPS, 1: Allow missing DroneCAN compasses to be automaticaly replaced (calibration still required)

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID4
param.documentation: Extra 4th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID5
param.documentation: Extra 5th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID6
param.documentation: Extra 6th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID7
param.documentation: Extra 7th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID8
param.documentation: Extra 8th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_CUS_ROLL
param.documentation: Compass mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: COMPASS_CUS_PIT
param.documentation: Compass mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: COMPASS_CUS_YAW
param.documentation: Compass mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT_EN
param.documentation: This enables per-motor compass corrections

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT_EXP
param.documentation: This is the exponential correction for the power output of the motor for per-motor compass correction

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT1_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor1

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT1_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor1

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT1_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor1

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT2_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor2

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT2_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor2

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT2_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor2

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT3_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor3

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT3_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor3

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT3_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor3

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT4_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor4

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT4_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor4

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT4_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor4

param.name: CUST_ROT_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables custom rotations

param.name: CUST_ROT1_ROLL
param.documentation: Custom euler roll, euler 321 (yaw, pitch, roll) ordering

param.name: CUST_ROT1_PITCH
param.documentation: Custom euler pitch, euler 321 (yaw, pitch, roll) ordering

param.name: CUST_ROT1_YAW
param.documentation: Custom euler yaw, euler 321 (yaw, pitch, roll) ordering

param.name: CUST_ROT2_ROLL
param.documentation: Custom euler roll, euler 321 (yaw, pitch, roll) ordering

param.name: CUST_ROT2_PITCH
param.documentation: Custom euler pitch, euler 321 (yaw, pitch, roll) ordering

param.name: CUST_ROT2_YAW
param.documentation: Custom euler yaw, euler 321 (yaw, pitch, roll) ordering

param.name: DDS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable DDS subsystem

param.name: DDS_UDP_PORT
param.documentation: UDP port number for DDS

param.name: DDS_DOMAIN_ID
param.documentation: Set the ROS_DOMAIN_ID

param.name: DDS_TIMEOUT_MS
param.documentation: The time in milliseconds the DDS client will wait for a response from the XRCE agent before reattempting.

param.name: DDS_MAX_RETRY
param.documentation: The maximum number of times the DDS client will attempt to ping the XRCE agent before exiting. Set to 0 to allow unlimited retries.

param.name: DDS_IP0
param.documentation: IPv4 address. Example: 192.xxx.xxx.xxx

param.name: DDS_IP1
param.documentation: IPv4 address. Example: xxx.168.xxx.xxx

param.name: DDS_IP2
param.documentation: IPv4 address. Example: xxx.xxx.144.xxx

param.name: DDS_IP3
param.documentation: IPv4 address. Example: xxx.xxx.xxx.14

param.name: DID_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable ODID subsystem

param.name: DID_MAVPORT
param.documentation: Serial port number to send OpenDroneID MAVLink messages to. Can be -1 if using DroneCAN.

param.name: DID_CANDRIVER
param.documentation: DroneCAN driver index, 0 to disable DroneCAN

param.name: DID_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Options for OpenDroneID subsystem

param.name: DID_BARO_ACC
param.documentation: Barometer Vertical Accuracy when installed in the vehicle. Note this is dependent upon installation conditions and thus disabled by default

param.name: EAHRS_TYPE
param.documentation: Type of AHRS device

param.name: EAHRS_RATE
param.documentation: Requested rate for AHRS device

param.name: EAHRS_OPTIONS
param.documentation: External AHRS options bitmask

bitmask.bit: Vector Nav use uncompensated values for accel gyro and mag.

param.field: 0:Vector Nav use uncompensated values for accel gyro and mag.

param.name: EAHRS_SENSORS
param.documentation: External AHRS sensors bitmask

param.name: EAHRS_LOG_RATE
param.documentation: Logging rate for EAHRS devices

param.name: EFI_TYPE
param.documentation: What method of communication is used for EFI #1

param.name: EFI_COEF1
param.documentation: Used to calibrate fuel flow for MS protocol (Slope). This should be calculated from a log at constant fuel usage rate. Plot (ECYL[0].InjT*EFI.Rpm)/600.0 to get the duty_cycle. Measure actual fuel usage in cm^3/min, and set EFI_COEF1 = fuel_usage_cm3permin / duty_cycle

param.name: EFI_COEF2
param.documentation: Used to calibrate fuel flow for MS protocol (Offset). This can be used to correct for a non-zero offset in the fuel consumption calculation of EFI_COEF1

param.name: EFI_FUEL_DENS
param.documentation: Used to calculate fuel consumption

param.name: EFI_THRLIN_EN
param.documentation: Enable EFI throttle linearisation

param.name: EFI_THRLIN_COEF1
param.documentation: First Order Polynomial Coefficient. (=1, if throttle is first order polynomial trendline)

param.name: EFI_THRLIN_COEF2
param.documentation: Second Order Polynomial Coefficient (=0, if throttle is second order polynomial trendline)

param.name: EFI_THRLIN_COEF3
param.documentation: Third Order Polynomial Coefficient. (=0, if throttle is third order polynomial trendline)

param.name: EFI_THRLIN_OFS
param.documentation: Offset for throttle linearization

param.name: EK2_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables EKF2. Enabling EKF2 only makes the maths run, it does not mean it will be used for flight control. To use it for flight control set AHRS_EKF_TYPE=2. A reboot or restart will need to be performed after changing the value of EK2_ENABLE for it to take effect.

param.name: EK2_GPS_TYPE
param.documentation: This controls use of GPS measurements : 0 = use 3D velocity & 2D position, 1 = use 2D velocity and 2D position, 2 = use 2D position, 3 = Inhibit GPS use - this can be useful when flying with an optical flow sensor in an environment where GPS quality is poor and subject to large multipath errors.

param.name: EK2_VELNE_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set horizontal velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS horizontal velocity measurements.

param.name: EK2_VELD_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set vertical velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS vertical velocity measurements.

param.name: EK2_VEL_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS velocity measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_POSNE_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets the GPS horizontal position observation noise. Increasing it reduces the weighting of GPS horizontal position measurements.

param.name: EK2_POS_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS position measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_GLITCH_RAD
param.documentation: This controls the maximum radial uncertainty in position between the value predicted by the filter and the value measured by the GPS before the filter position and velocity states are reset to the GPS. Making this value larger allows the filter to ignore larger GPS glitches but also means that non-GPS errors such as IMU and compass can create a larger error in position before the filter is forced back to the GPS position.

param.name: EK2_ALT_SOURCE
param.documentation: Primary height sensor used by the EKF. If a sensor other than Baro is selected and becomes unavailable, then the Baro sensor will be used as a fallback. NOTE: The EK2_RNG_USE_HGT parameter can be used to switch to range-finder when close to the ground in conjunction with EK2_ALT_SOURCE = 0 or 2 (Baro or GPS).

param.name: EK2_ALT_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the altitude measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the baro measurement and will make the filter respond more slowly to baro measurement errors, but will make it more sensitive to GPS and accelerometer errors.

param.name: EK2_HGT_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the height measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_HGT_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the Height measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

param.name: EK2_MAG_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in magnetometer measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK2_MAG_CAL
param.documentation: This determines when the filter will use the 3-axis magnetometer fusion model that estimates both earth and body fixed magnetic field states, when it will use a simpler magnetic heading fusion model that does not use magnetic field states and when it will use an alternative method of yaw determination to the magnetometer. The 3-axis magnetometer fusion is only suitable for use when the external magnetic field environment is stable. EK2_MAG_CAL = 0 uses heading fusion on ground, 3-axis fusion in-flight, and is the default setting for Plane users. EK2_MAG_CAL = 1 uses 3-axis fusion only when manoeuvring. EK2_MAG_CAL = 2 uses heading fusion at all times, is recommended if the external magnetic field is varying and is the default for rovers. EK2_MAG_CAL = 3 uses heading fusion on the ground and 3-axis fusion after the first in-air field and yaw reset has completed, and is the default for copters. EK2_MAG_CAL = 4 uses 3-axis fusion at all times. NOTE: The fusion mode can be forced to 2 for specific EKF cores using the EK2_MAG_MASK parameter. NOTE: limited operation without a magnetometer or any other yaw sensor is possible by setting all COMPASS_USE, COMPASS_USE2, COMPASS_USE3, etc parameters to 0 with COMPASS_ENABLE set to 1. If this is done, the EK2_GSF_RUN and EK2_GSF_USE masks must be set to the same as EK2_IMU_MASK.

param.name: EK2_MAG_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_EAS_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in equivalent airspeed measurements used by planes. Increasing it reduces the weighting of airspeed measurements and will make wind speed estimates less noisy and slower to converge. Increasing also increases navigation errors when dead-reckoning without GPS measurements.

param.name: EK2_EAS_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the airspeed measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_RNG_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the range finder measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

param.name: EK2_RNG_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the range finder innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_MAX_FLOW
param.documentation: This sets the magnitude maximum optical flow rate in rad/sec that will be accepted by the filter

param.name: EK2_FLOW_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise and errors in optical flow measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK2_FLOW_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the optical flow innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_FLOW_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the optical flow measurements lag behind the inertial measurements. It is the time from the end of the optical flow averaging period and does not include the time delay due to the 100msec of averaging within the flow sensor.

param.name: EK2_GYRO_P_NSE
param.documentation: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to gyro measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the gyro measurements less and other measurements more.

param.name: EK2_ACC_P_NSE
param.documentation: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to accelerometer measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the accelerometer measurements less and other measurements more.

param.name: EK2_GBIAS_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls growth of the gyro delta angle bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes rate gyro bias estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK2_GSCL_P_NSE
param.documentation: This noise controls the rate of gyro scale factor learning. Increasing it makes rate gyro scale factor estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK2_ABIAS_P_NSE
param.documentation: This noise controls the growth of the vertical accelerometer delta velocity bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes accelerometer bias estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK2_WIND_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls the growth of wind state error estimates. Increasing it makes wind estimation faster and noisier.

param.humanName: Height rate to wind process noise scaler
param.name: EK2_WIND_PSCALE
param.documentation: This controls how much the process noise on the wind states is increased when gaining or losing altitude to take into account changes in wind speed and direction with altitude. Increasing this parameter increases how rapidly the wind states adapt when changing altitude, but does make wind velocity estimation noiser.

param.name: EK2_GPS_CHECK
param.documentation: This is a 1 byte bitmap controlling which GPS preflight checks are performed. Set to 0 to bypass all checks. Set to 255 perform all checks. Set to 3 to check just the number of satellites and HDoP. Set to 31 for the most rigorous checks that will still allow checks to pass when the copter is moving, eg launch from a boat.
param.field: 0:NSats,1:HDoP,2:speed error,3:position error,4:yaw error,5:pos drift,6:vert speed,7:horiz speed

param.name: EK2_IMU_MASK
param.documentation: 1 byte bitmap of IMUs to use in EKF2. A separate instance of EKF2 will be started for each IMU selected. Set to 1 to use the first IMU only (default), set to 2 to use the second IMU only, set to 3 to use the first and second IMU. Additional IMU's can be used up to a maximum of 6 if memory and processing resources permit. There may be insufficient memory and processing resources to run multiple instances. If this occurs EKF2 will fail to start.

param.name: EK2_CHECK_SCALE
param.documentation: This scales the thresholds that are used to check GPS accuracy before it is used by the EKF. A value of 100 is the default. Values greater than 100 increase and values less than 100 reduce the maximum GPS error the EKF will accept. A value of 200 will double the allowable GPS error.

param.name: EK2_NOAID_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets the amount of position variation that the EKF allows for when operating without external measurements (eg GPS or optical flow). Increasing this parameter makes the EKF attitude estimate less sensitive to vehicle manoeuvres but more sensitive to IMU errors.

param.name: EK2_YAW_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in yaw measurements from the magnetometer. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK2_YAW_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer yaw measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_TAU_OUTPUT
param.documentation: Sets the time constant of the output complementary filter/predictor in centi-seconds.

param.name: EK2_MAGE_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls the growth of earth magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes earth magnetic field estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK2_MAGB_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls the growth of body magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes magnetometer bias error estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK2_RNG_USE_HGT
param.documentation: Range finder can be used as the primary height source when below this percentage of its maximum range (see RNGFND*_MAX). This will not work unless Baro or GPS height is selected as the primary height source vis EK2_ALT_SOURCE = 0 or 2 respectively. This feature should not be used for terrain following as it is designed for vertical takeoff and landing with climb above the range finder use height before commencing the mission, and with horizontal position changes below that height being limited to a flat region around the takeoff and landing point.

param.name: EK2_TERR_GRAD
param.documentation: Specifies the maximum gradient of the terrain below the vehicle assumed when it is fusing range finder or optical flow to estimate terrain height.

param.name: EK2_BCN_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the range beacon measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

param.name: EK2_BCN_I_GTE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the range beacon measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_BCN_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the range beacon measurements lag behind the inertial measurements. It is the time from the end of the optical flow averaging period and does not include the time delay due to the 100msec of averaging within the flow sensor.

param.name: EK2_RNG_USE_SPD
param.documentation: The range finder will not be used as the primary height source when the horizontal ground speed is greater than this value.

param.humanName: Bitmask of active EKF cores that will always use heading fusion
param.name: EK2_MAG_MASK
param.documentation: 1 byte bitmap of EKF cores that will disable magnetic field states and use simple magnetic heading fusion at all times. This parameter enables specified cores to be used as a backup for flight into an environment with high levels of external magnetic interference which may degrade the EKF attitude estimate when using 3-axis magnetometer fusion. NOTE : Use of a different magnetometer fusion algorithm on different cores makes unwanted EKF core switches due to magnetometer errors more likely.

param.humanName: Bitmask control of EKF reference height correction
param.name: EK2_OGN_HGT_MASK
param.documentation: When a height sensor other than GPS is used as the primary height source by the EKF, the position of the zero height datum is defined by that sensor and its frame of reference. If a GPS height measurement is also available, then the height of the WGS-84 height datum used by the EKF can be corrected so that the height returned by the getLLH() function is compensated for primary height sensor drift and change in datum over time. The first two bit positions control when the height datum will be corrected. Correction is performed using a Bayes filter and only operates when GPS quality permits. The third bit position controls where the corrections to the GPS reference datum are applied. Corrections can be applied to the local vertical position or to the reported EKF origin height (default).

bitmask.bit: Correct when using range finder height

param.field: 0:Correct when using Baro height,1:Correct when using range finder height,2:Apply corrections to local position

param.name: EK2_FLOW_USE
param.documentation: Controls if the optical flow data is fused into the 24-state navigation estimator OR the 1-state terrain height estimator.

param.name: EK2_MAG_EF_LIM
param.documentation: This limits the difference between the learned earth magnetic field and the earth field from the world magnetic model tables. A value of zero means to disable the use of the WMM tables.

param.name: EK2_HRT_FILT
param.documentation: Specifies the crossover frequency of the complementary filter used to calculate the output predictor height rate derivative.

param.humanName: Bitmask of which EKF-GSF yaw estimators run
param.name: EK2_GSF_RUN_MASK
param.documentation: A bitmask of which EKF2 instances run an independant EKF-GSF yaw estimator to provide a backup yaw estimate that doesn't rely on magnetometer data. This estimator uses IMU, GPS and, if available, airspeed data. EKF-GSF yaw estimator data for the primary EKF2 instance will be logged as GSF0 and GSF1 messages. Use of the yaw estimate generated by this algorithm is controlled by the EK2_GSF_USE_MASK and EK2_GSF_RST_MAX parameters. To run the EKF-GSF yaw estimator in ride-along and logging only, set EK2_GSF_USE_MASK to 0.

param.humanName: Bitmask of which EKF-GSF yaw estimators are used
param.name: EK2_GSF_USE_MASK
param.documentation: 1 byte bitmap of which EKF2 instances will use the output from the EKF-GSF yaw estimator that has been turned on by the EK2_GSF_RUN_MASK parameter. If the inertial navigation calculation stops following the GPS, then the vehicle code can request EKF2 to attempt to resolve the issue, either by performing a yaw reset if enabled by this parameter by switching to another EKF2 instance.

param.humanName: Maximum number of resets to the EKF-GSF yaw estimate allowed
param.name: EK2_GSF_RST_MAX
param.documentation: Sets the maximum number of times the EKF2 will be allowed to reset its yaw to the estimate from the EKF-GSF yaw estimator. No resets will be allowed unless the use of the EKF-GSF yaw estimate is enabled via the EK2_GSF_USE_MASK parameter.

param.name: EK2_OPTIONS
param.documentation: optional EKF2 behaviour. Disabling external navigation prevents use of external vision data in the EKF2 solution

param.name: EK3_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables EKF3. Enabling EKF3 only makes the maths run, it does not mean it will be used for flight control. To use it for flight control set AHRS_EKF_TYPE=3. A reboot or restart will need to be performed after changing the value of EK3_ENABLE for it to take effect.

param.name: EK3_VELNE_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set horizontal velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS horizontal velocity measurements.

param.name: EK3_VELD_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set vertical velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS vertical velocity measurements.

param.name: EK3_VEL_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS velocity measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted. If EK3_GLITCH_RAD set to 0 the velocity innovations will be clipped instead of rejected if they exceed the gate size and a smaller value of EK3_VEL_I_GATE not exceeding 300 is recommended to limit the effect of GPS transient errors.

param.name: EK3_POSNE_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets the GPS horizontal position observation noise. Increasing it reduces the weighting of GPS horizontal position measurements.

param.name: EK3_POS_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS position measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted. If EK3_GLITCH_RAD has been set to 0 the horizontal position innovations will be clipped instead of rejected if they exceed the gate size so a smaller value of EK3_POS_I_GATE not exceeding 300 is recommended to limit the effect of GPS transient errors.

param.name: EK3_GLITCH_RAD
param.documentation: This controls the maximum radial uncertainty in position between the value predicted by the filter and the value measured by the GPS before the filter position and velocity states are reset to the GPS. Making this value larger allows the filter to ignore larger GPS glitches but also means that non-GPS errors such as IMU and compass can create a larger error in position before the filter is forced back to the GPS position. If EK3_GLITCH_RAD set to 0 the GPS innovations will be clipped instead of rejected if they exceed the gate size set by EK3_VEL_I_GATE and EK3_POS_I_GATE which can be useful if poor quality sensor data is causing GPS rejection and loss of navigation but does make the EKF more susceptible to GPS glitches. If setting EK3_GLITCH_RAD to 0 it is recommended to reduce EK3_VEL_I_GATE and EK3_POS_I_GATE to 300.

param.name: EK3_ALT_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the altitude measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the baro measurement and will make the filter respond more slowly to baro measurement errors, but will make it more sensitive to GPS and accelerometer errors. A larger value for EK3_ALT_M_NSE may be required when operating with EK3_SRCx_POSZ = 0. This parameter also sets the noise for the 'synthetic' zero height measurement that is used when EK3_SRCx_POSZ = 0.

param.name: EK3_HGT_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the height measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted. If EK3_GLITCH_RAD set to 0 the vertical position innovations will be clipped instead of rejected if they exceed the gate size and a smaller value of EK3_HGT_I_GATE not exceeding 300 is recommended to limit the effect of height sensor transient errors.

param.name: EK3_HGT_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the Height measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

param.name: EK3_MAG_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in magnetometer measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK3_MAG_CAL
param.documentation: This determines when the filter will use the 3-axis magnetometer fusion model that estimates both earth and body fixed magnetic field states and when it will use a simpler magnetic heading fusion model that does not use magnetic field states. The 3-axis magnetometer fusion is only suitable for use when the external magnetic field environment is stable. EK3_MAG_CAL = 0 uses heading fusion on ground, 3-axis fusion in-flight, and is the default setting for Plane users. EK3_MAG_CAL = 1 uses 3-axis fusion only when manoeuvring. EK3_MAG_CAL = 2 uses heading fusion at all times, is recommended if the external magnetic field is varying and is the default for rovers. EK3_MAG_CAL = 3 uses heading fusion on the ground and 3-axis fusion after the first in-air field and yaw reset has completed, and is the default for copters. EK3_MAG_CAL = 4 uses 3-axis fusion at all times. EK3_MAG_CAL = 5 uses an external yaw sensor with simple heading fusion. NOTE : Use of simple heading magnetometer fusion makes vehicle compass calibration and alignment errors harder for the EKF to detect which reduces the sensitivity of the Copter EKF failsafe algorithm. NOTE: The fusion mode can be forced to 2 for specific EKF cores using the EK3_MAG_MASK parameter. EK3_MAG_CAL = 6 uses an external yaw sensor with fallback to compass when the external sensor is not available if we are flying. NOTE: The fusion mode can be forced to 2 for specific EKF cores using the EK3_MAG_MASK parameter. NOTE: limited operation without a magnetometer or any other yaw sensor is possible by setting all COMPASS_USE, COMPASS_USE2, COMPASS_USE3, etc parameters to 0 and setting COMPASS_ENABLE to 0. If this is done, the EK3_GSF_RUN and EK3_GSF_USE masks must be set to the same as EK3_IMU_MASK. A yaw angle derived from IMU and GPS velocity data using a Gaussian Sum Filter (GSF) will then be used to align the yaw when flight commences and there is sufficient movement.

values.value: Use external yaw sensor (Deprecated in 4.1+ see EK3_SRCn_YAW)
External yaw sensor with compass fallback (Deprecated in 4.1+ see EK3_SRCn_YAW)

param.name: EK3_MAG_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK3_EAS_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in equivalent airspeed measurements used by planes. Increasing it reduces the weighting of airspeed measurements and will make wind speed estimates less noisy and slower to converge. Increasing also increases navigation errors when dead-reckoning without GPS measurements.

param.name: EK3_EAS_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the airspeed measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK3_RNG_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the range finder measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

param.name: EK3_RNG_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the range finder innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK3_FLOW_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum optical flow rate in rad/sec that will be accepted by the filter. Flow rates above this value will not be fused.

param.name: EK3_FLOW_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise and errors in optical flow measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK3_FLOW_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the optical flow innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK3_FLOW_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the optical flow measurements lag behind the inertial measurements. It is the time from the end of the optical flow averaging period and does not include the time delay due to the 100msec of averaging within the flow sensor.

param.name: EK3_GYRO_P_NSE
param.documentation: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to gyro measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the gyro measurements less and other measurements more.

param.name: EK3_ACC_P_NSE
param.documentation: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to accelerometer measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the accelerometer measurements less and other measurements more.

param.name: EK3_GBIAS_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls growth of the gyro delta angle bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes rate gyro bias estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK3_ABIAS_P_NSE
param.documentation: This noise controls the growth of the vertical accelerometer delta velocity bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes accelerometer bias estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK3_WIND_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls the growth of wind state error estimates. Increasing it makes wind estimation faster and noisier.

param.humanName: Height rate to wind process noise scaler
param.name: EK3_WIND_PSCALE
param.documentation: This controls how much the process noise on the wind states is increased when gaining or losing altitude to take into account changes in wind speed and direction with altitude. Increasing this parameter increases how rapidly the wind states adapt when changing altitude, but does make wind velocity estimation noiser.

param.name: EK3_GPS_CHECK
param.documentation: This is a 1 byte bitmap controlling which GPS preflight checks are performed. Set to 0 to bypass all checks. Set to 255 perform all checks. Set to 3 to check just the number of satellites and HDoP. Set to 31 for the most rigorous checks that will still allow checks to pass when the copter is moving, eg launch from a boat.
param.field: 0:NSats,1:HDoP,2:speed error,3:position error,4:yaw error,5:pos drift,6:vert speed,7:horiz speed

param.name: EK3_IMU_MASK
param.documentation: 1 byte bitmap of IMUs to use in EKF3. A separate instance of EKF3 will be started for each IMU selected. Set to 1 to use the first IMU only (default), set to 2 to use the second IMU only, set to 3 to use the first and second IMU. Additional IMU's can be used up to a maximum of 6 if memory and processing resources permit. There may be insufficient memory and processing resources to run multiple instances. If this occurs EKF3 will fail to start.

param.name: EK3_CHECK_SCALE
param.documentation: This scales the thresholds that are used to check GPS accuracy before it is used by the EKF. A value of 100 is the default. Values greater than 100 increase and values less than 100 reduce the maximum GPS error the EKF will accept. A value of 200 will double the allowable GPS error.

param.name: EK3_NOAID_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets the amount of position variation that the EKF allows for when operating without external measurements (eg GPS or optical flow). Increasing this parameter makes the EKF attitude estimate less sensitive to vehicle manoeuvres but more sensitive to IMU errors.

param.name: EK3_BETA_MASK
param.documentation: 1 byte bitmap controlling use of sideslip angle fusion for estimation of non wind states during operation of 'fly forward' vehicle types such as fixed wing planes. By assuming that the angle of sideslip is small, the wind velocity state estimates are corrected whenever the EKF is not dead reckoning (e.g. has an independent velocity or position sensor such as GPS). This behaviour is on by default and cannot be disabled. When the EKF is dead reckoning, the wind states are used as a reference, enabling use of the small angle of sideslip assumption to correct non wind velocity states (eg attitude, velocity, position, etc) and improve navigation accuracy. This behaviour is on by default and cannot be disabled. The behaviour controlled by this parameter is the use of the small angle of sideslip assumption to correct non wind velocity states when the EKF is NOT dead reckoning. This is primarily of benefit to reduce the buildup of yaw angle errors during straight and level flight without a yaw sensor (e.g. magnetometer or dual antenna GPS yaw) provided aerobatic flight maneuvers with large sideslip angles are not performed. The 'always' option might be used where the yaw sensor is intentionally not fitted or disabled. The 'WhenNoYawSensor' option might be used if a yaw sensor is fitted, but protection against in-flight failure and continual rejection by the EKF is desired. For vehicles operated within visual range of the operator performing frequent turning maneuvers, setting this parameter is unnecessary.

param.name: EK3_YAW_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in yaw measurements from the magnetometer. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK3_YAW_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer yaw measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK3_TAU_OUTPUT
param.documentation: Sets the time constant of the output complementary filter/predictor in centi-seconds.

param.name: EK3_MAGE_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls the growth of earth magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes earth magnetic field estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK3_MAGB_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls the growth of body magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes magnetometer bias error estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK3_RNG_USE_HGT
param.documentation: Range finder can be used as the primary height source when below this percentage of its maximum range (see RNGFNDx_MAX) and the primary height source is Baro or GPS (see EK3_SRCx_POSZ). This feature should not be used for terrain following as it is designed for vertical takeoff and landing with climb above the range finder use height before commencing the mission, and with horizontal position changes below that height being limited to a flat region around the takeoff and landing point.

param.name: EK3_TERR_GRAD
param.documentation: Specifies the maximum gradient of the terrain below the vehicle when it is using range finder as a height reference

param.name: EK3_BCN_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the range beacon measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

param.name: EK3_BCN_I_GTE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the range beacon measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK3_BCN_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the range beacon measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

param.name: EK3_RNG_USE_SPD
param.documentation: The range finder will not be used as the primary height source when the horizontal ground speed is greater than this value.

param.name: EK3_ACC_BIAS_LIM
param.documentation: The accelerometer bias state will be limited to +- this value

param.humanName: Bitmask of active EKF cores that will always use heading fusion
param.name: EK3_MAG_MASK
param.documentation: 1 byte bitmap of EKF cores that will disable magnetic field states and use simple magnetic heading fusion at all times. This parameter enables specified cores to be used as a backup for flight into an environment with high levels of external magnetic interference which may degrade the EKF attitude estimate when using 3-axis magnetometer fusion. NOTE : Use of a different magnetometer fusion algorithm on different cores makes unwanted EKF core switches due to magnetometer errors more likely.

param.humanName: Bitmask control of EKF reference height correction
param.name: EK3_OGN_HGT_MASK
param.documentation: When a height sensor other than GPS is used as the primary height source by the EKF, the position of the zero height datum is defined by that sensor and its frame of reference. If a GPS height measurement is also available, then the height of the WGS-84 height datum used by the EKF can be corrected so that the height returned by the getLLH() function is compensated for primary height sensor drift and change in datum over time. The first two bit positions control when the height datum will be corrected. Correction is performed using a Bayes filter and only operates when GPS quality permits. The third bit position controls where the corrections to the GPS reference datum are applied. Corrections can be applied to the local vertical position or to the reported EKF origin height (default).

bitmask.bit: Correct when using range finder height

param.field: 0:Correct when using Baro height,1:Correct when using range finder height,2:Apply corrections to local position

param.name: EK3_VIS_VERR_MIN
param.documentation: This is the 1-STD odometry velocity observation error that will be assumed when maximum quality is reported by the sensor. When quality is between max and min, the error will be calculated using linear interpolation between VIS_VERR_MIN and VIS_VERR_MAX.

param.name: EK3_VIS_VERR_MAX
param.documentation: This is the 1-STD odometry velocity observation error that will be assumed when minimum quality is reported by the sensor. When quality is between max and min, the error will be calculated using linear interpolation between VIS_VERR_MIN and VIS_VERR_MAX.

param.name: EK3_WENC_VERR
param.documentation: This is the 1-STD odometry velocity observation error that will be assumed when wheel encoder data is being fused.

param.name: EK3_FLOW_USE
param.documentation: Controls if the optical flow data is fused into the 24-state navigation estimator OR the 1-state terrain height estimator.

param.name: EK3_HRT_FILT
param.documentation: Specifies the crossover frequency of the complementary filter used to calculate the output predictor height rate derivative.

param.name: EK3_MAG_EF_LIM
param.documentation: This limits the difference between the learned earth magnetic field and the earth field from the world magnetic model tables. A value of zero means to disable the use of the WMM tables.

param.humanName: Bitmask of which EKF-GSF yaw estimators run
param.name: EK3_GSF_RUN_MASK
param.documentation: 1 byte bitmap of which EKF3 instances run an independent EKF-GSF yaw estimator to provide a backup yaw estimate that doesn't rely on magnetometer data. This estimator uses IMU, GPS and, if available, airspeed data. EKF-GSF yaw estimator data for the primary EKF3 instance will be logged as GSF0 and GSF1 messages. Use of the yaw estimate generated by this algorithm is controlled by the EK3_GSF_USE_MASK and EK3_GSF_RST_MAX parameters. To run the EKF-GSF yaw estimator in ride-along and logging only, set EK3_GSF_USE to 0.

param.humanName: Bitmask of which EKF-GSF yaw estimators are used
param.name: EK3_GSF_USE_MASK
param.documentation: A bitmask of which EKF3 instances will use the output from the EKF-GSF yaw estimator that has been turned on by the EK3_GSF_RUN_MASK parameter. If the inertial navigation calculation stops following the GPS, then the vehicle code can request EKF3 to attempt to resolve the issue, either by performing a yaw reset if enabled by this parameter by switching to another EKF3 instance.

param.humanName: Maximum number of resets to the EKF-GSF yaw estimate allowed
param.name: EK3_GSF_RST_MAX
param.documentation: Sets the maximum number of times the EKF3 will be allowed to reset its yaw to the estimate from the EKF-GSF yaw estimator. No resets will be allowed unless the use of the EKF-GSF yaw estimate is enabled via the EK3_GSF_USE_MASK parameter.

param.humanName: EKF3 Lane Relative Error Sensitivity Threshold
param.name: EK3_ERR_THRESH
param.documentation: lanes have to be consistently better than the primary by at least this threshold to reduce their overall relativeCoreError, lowering this makes lane switching more sensitive to smaller error differences

param.name: EK3_AFFINITY
param.documentation: These options control the affinity between sensor instances and EKF cores

param.humanName: Ballistic coefficient for X axis drag
param.name: EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X
param.documentation: Ratio of mass to drag coefficient measured along the X body axis. This parameter enables estimation of wind drift for vehicles with bluff bodies and without propulsion forces in the X and Y direction (eg multicopters). The drag produced by this effect scales with speed squared. Set to a positive value > 1.0 to enable. A starting value is the mass in Kg divided by the frontal area. The predicted drag from the rotors is specified separately by the EK3_DRAG_MCOEF parameter.

param.humanName: Ballistic coefficient for Y axis drag
param.name: EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y
param.documentation: Ratio of mass to drag coefficient measured along the Y body axis. This parameter enables estimation of wind drift for vehicles with bluff bodies and without propulsion forces in the X and Y direction (eg multicopters). The drag produced by this effect scales with speed squared. Set to a positive value > 1.0 to enable. A starting value is the mass in Kg divided by the side area. The predicted drag from the rotors is specified separately by the EK3_DRAG_MCOEF parameter.

param.name: EK3_DRAG_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets the amount of noise used when fusing X and Y acceleration as an observation that enables estimation of wind velocity for multi-rotor vehicles. This feature is enabled by the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters

param.name: EK3_DRAG_MCOEF
param.documentation: This parameter is used to predict the drag produced by the rotors when flying a multi-copter, enabling estimation of wind drift. The drag produced by this effect scales with speed not speed squared and is produced because some of the air velocity normal to the rotors axis of rotation is lost when passing through the rotor disc which changes the momentum of the airflow causing drag. For unducted rotors the effect is roughly proportional to the area of the propeller blades when viewed side on and changes with different propellers. It is higher for ducted rotors. For example if flying at 15 m/s at sea level conditions produces a rotor induced drag acceleration of 1.5 m/s/s, then EK3_DRAG_MCOEF would be set to 0.1 = (1.5/15.0). Set EK3_MCOEF to a positive value to enable wind estimation using this drag effect. To account for the drag produced by the body which scales with speed squared, see documentation for the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters.

param.humanName: On ground not moving test scale factor
param.name: EK3_OGNM_TEST_SF
param.documentation: This parameter is adjust the sensitivity of the on ground not moving test which is used to assist with learning the yaw gyro bias and stopping yaw drift before flight when operating without a yaw sensor. Bigger values allow the detection of a not moving condition with noiser IMU data. Check the XKFM data logged when the vehicle is on ground not moving and adjust the value of OGNM_TEST_SF to be slightly higher than the maximum value of the XKFM.ADR, XKFM.ALR, XKFM.GDR and XKFM.GLR test levels.

param.humanName: Baro height ground effect dead zone
param.name: EK3_GND_EFF_DZ
param.documentation: This parameter sets the size of the dead zone that is applied to negative baro height spikes that can occur when taking off or landing when a vehicle with lift rotors is operating in ground effect ground effect. Set to about 0.5m less than the amount of negative offset in baro height that occurs just prior to takeoff when lift motors are spooling up. Set to 0 if no ground effect is present.

param.name: EK3_PRIMARY
param.documentation: The core number (index in IMU mask) that will be used as the primary EKF core on startup. While disarmed the EKF will force the use of this core. A value of 0 corresponds to the first IMU in EK3_IMU_MASK.

param.name: EK3_LOG_LEVEL
param.documentation: Determines how verbose the EKF3 streaming logging is. A value of 0 provides full logging(default), a value of 1 only XKF4 scaled innovations are logged, a value of 2 both XKF4 and GSF are logged, and a value of 3 disables all streaming logging of EKF3.

param.name: EK3_GPS_VACC_MAX
param.documentation: Vertical accuracy threshold for GPS as the altitude source. The GPS will not be used as an altitude source if the reported vertical accuracy of the GPS is larger than this threshold, falling back to baro instead. Set to zero to deactivate the threshold check.

param.name: EK3_OPTIONS
param.documentation: EKF optional behaviour. Bit 0 (JammingExpected): Setting JammingExpected will change the EKF behaviour such that if dead reckoning navigation is possible it will require the preflight alignment GPS quality checks controlled by EK3_GPS_CHECK and EK3_CHECK_SCALE to pass before resuming GPS use if GPS lock is lost for more than 2 seconds to prevent bad position estimate. Bit 1 (Manual lane switching): DANGEROUS If enabled, this disables automatic lane switching. If the active lane becomes unhealthy, no automatic switching will occur. Users must manually set EK3_PRIMARY to change lanes. No health checks will be performed on the selected lane. Use with extreme caution. Bit 2 (Optflow may use terrain alt): Terrain SRTM data will be used if the vehicle climbs above the rangefinder's range allowing optical flow to be used at higher altitudes.

param.name: EK3_SRC1_POSXY
param.documentation: Position Horizontal Source (Primary)

param.name: EK3_SRC1_VELXY
param.documentation: Velocity Horizontal Source

param.name: EK3_SRC1_POSZ
param.documentation: Position Vertical Source

param.name: EK3_SRC1_VELZ
param.documentation: Velocity Vertical Source

param.name: EK3_SRC1_YAW
param.documentation: Yaw Source

param.name: EK3_SRC2_POSXY
param.documentation: Position Horizontal Source (Secondary)

param.name: EK3_SRC2_VELXY
param.documentation: Velocity Horizontal Source (Secondary)

param.name: EK3_SRC2_POSZ
param.documentation: Position Vertical Source (Secondary)

param.name: EK3_SRC2_VELZ
param.documentation: Velocity Vertical Source (Secondary)

param.name: EK3_SRC2_YAW
param.documentation: Yaw Source (Secondary)

param.name: EK3_SRC3_POSXY
param.documentation: Position Horizontal Source (Tertiary)

param.name: EK3_SRC3_VELXY
param.documentation: Velocity Horizontal Source (Tertiary)

param.name: EK3_SRC3_POSZ
param.documentation: Position Vertical Source (Tertiary)

param.name: EK3_SRC3_VELZ
param.documentation: Velocity Vertical Source (Tertiary)

param.name: EK3_SRC3_YAW
param.documentation: Yaw Source (Tertiary)

param.name: EK3_SRC_OPTIONS
param.documentation: EKF Source Options. Bit 0: Fuse all velocity sources present in EK3_SRCx_VEL_. Bit 1: Align external navigation position when using optical flow. Bit 3: Use SRC per core. By default, EKF source selection is controlled via the EK3_SRC parameters, allowing only one source to be active at a time across all cores (switchable via MAVLink, Lua, or RC). Enabling this bit maps EKF core 1 to SRC1, core 2 to SRC2, etc., allowing each core to run independently with a dedicated source.

param.name: ESC_TLM_MAV_OFS
param.documentation: Offset to apply to ESC numbers when reporting as ESC_TELEMETRY packets over MAVLink. This allows high numbered motors to be displayed as low numbered ESCs for convenience on GCS displays. A value of 4 would send ESC on output 5 as ESC number 1 in ESC_TELEMETRY packets

param.name: FENCE_ENABLE
param.documentation: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the fence functionality. Fences can still be enabled and disabled via mavlink or an RC option, but these changes are not persisted.

param.name: FENCE_ACTION
param.documentation: What action should be taken when fence is breached

param.name: FENCE_RADIUS
param.documentation: Circle fence radius which when breached will cause an RTL

param.name: FENCE_MARGIN
param.documentation: Distance that autopilot's should maintain from the fence to avoid a breach

param.name: FENCE_TOTAL
param.documentation: Number of polygon points saved in eeprom (do not update manually)

param.name: FENCE_OPTIONS
param.documentation: When bit 0 is set disable mode change following fence action until fence breach is cleared. When bit 1 is set the allowable flight areas is the union of all polygon and circle fence areas instead of the intersection, which means a fence breach occurs only if you are outside all of the fence areas.

bitmask.bit: Disable mode change following fence action until fence breach is cleared

param.field: 0:Disable mode change following fence action until fence breach is cleared, 1:Allow union of inclusion areas, 2:Notify on margin breaches

param.humanName: Fence margin notification frequency in hz
param.name: FENCE_NTF_FREQ
param.documentation: When bit 2 of FENCE_OPTIONS is set this parameter controls the frequency of margin breach notifications. If set to 0 only new margin breaches are notified.

param.name: FENCE_MARGIN_XY
param.documentation: Distance that autopilot's should maintain from the fence in the horizontal plane to avoid a breach. If set to 0 then FENCE_MARGIN is used.

param.name: FFT_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable Gyro FFT analyser

param.name: FFT_MINHZ
param.documentation: Lower bound of FFT frequency detection in Hz. On larger vehicles the minimum motor frequency is likely to be significantly lower than for smaller vehicles.

param.name: FFT_MAXHZ
param.documentation: Upper bound of FFT frequency detection in Hz. On smaller vehicles the maximum motor frequency is likely to be significantly higher than for larger vehicles.

param.name: FFT_SAMPLE_MODE
param.documentation: Sampling mode (and therefore rate). 0: Gyro rate sampling, 1: Fast loop rate sampling, 2: Fast loop rate / 2 sampling, 3: Fast loop rate / 3 sampling. Takes effect on reboot.

param.name: FFT_WINDOW_SIZE
param.documentation: Size of window to be used in FFT calculations. Takes effect on reboot. Must be a power of 2 and between 32 and 512. Larger windows give greater frequency resolution but poorer time resolution, consume more CPU time and may not be appropriate for all vehicles. Time and frequency resolution are given by the sample-rate / window-size. Windows of 256 are only really recommended for F7 class boards, windows of 512 or more H7 class.

param.name: FFT_WINDOW_OLAP
param.documentation: Percentage of window to be overlapped before another frame is process. Takes effect on reboot. A good default is 50% overlap. Higher overlap results in more processed frames but not necessarily more temporal resolution. Lower overlap results in lost information at the frame edges.

param.name: FFT_FREQ_HOVER
param.documentation: The learned hover noise frequency

param.name: FFT_THR_REF
param.documentation: FFT learned thrust reference for the hover frequency and FFT minimum frequency.

param.name: FFT_SNR_REF
param.documentation: FFT SNR reference threshold in dB at which a signal is determined to be present.

param.name: FFT_ATT_REF
param.documentation: FFT attenuation level in dB for bandwidth calculation and peak detection. The bandwidth is calculated by comparing peak power output with the attenuated version. The default of 15 has shown to be a good compromise in both simulations and real flight.

param.name: FFT_BW_HOVER
param.documentation: FFT learned bandwidth at hover for the attenuation frequencies.

param.name: FFT_HMNC_FIT
param.documentation: FFT harmonic fit frequency threshold percentage at which a signal of the appropriate frequency is determined to be the harmonic of another. Signals that have a harmonic relationship that varies at most by this percentage are considered harmonics of each other for the purpose of selecting the harmonic notch frequency. If a match is found then the lower frequency harmonic is always used as the basis for the dynamic harmonic notch. A value of zero completely disables harmonic matching.

param.name: FFT_HMNC_PEAK
param.documentation: The FFT harmonic peak target that should be returned by FTN1.PkAvg. The resulting value will be used by the harmonic notch if configured to track the FFT frequency. By default the appropriate peak is auto-detected based on the harmonic fit between peaks and the energy-weighted average frequency on roll on pitch is used. Setting this to 1 will always target the highest energy peak. Setting this to 2 will target the highest energy peak that is lower in frequency than the highest energy peak. Setting this to 3 will target the highest energy peak that is higher in frequency than the highest energy peak. Setting this to 4 will target the highest energy peak on the roll axis only and only the roll frequency will be used (some vehicles have a much more pronounced peak on roll). Setting this to 5 will target the highest energy peak on the pitch axis only and only the pitch frequency will be used (some vehicles have a much more pronounced peak on roll).

param.humanName: FFT output frames to retain and average
param.name: FFT_NUM_FRAMES
param.documentation: Number of output frequency frames to retain and average in order to calculate final frequencies. Averaging output frames can drastically reduce noise and jitter at the cost of latency as long as the input is stable. The default is to perform no averaging. For rapidly changing frequencies (e.g. smaller aircraft) fewer frames should be averaged.

param.name: FFT_OPTIONS
param.documentation: FFT configuration options. Values: 1:Apply the FFT *after* the filter bank,2:Check noise at the motor frequencies using ESC data as a reference

param.name: FILT1_TYPE
param.documentation: Filter Type

param.name: FILT1_NOTCH_FREQ
param.documentation: Notch Filter center frequency in Hz.

param.name: FILT1_NOTCH_Q
param.documentation: Notch Filter quality factor given by the notch centre frequency divided by its bandwidth.

param.name: FILT1_NOTCH_ATT
param.documentation: Notch Filter attenuation in dB.

param.name: FILT2_TYPE
param.documentation: Filter Type

param.name: FILT2_NOTCH_FREQ
param.documentation: Notch Filter center frequency in Hz.

param.name: FILT2_NOTCH_Q
param.documentation: Notch Filter quality factor given by the notch centre frequency divided by its bandwidth.

param.name: FILT2_NOTCH_ATT
param.documentation: Notch Filter attenuation in dB.

param.name: FILT3_TYPE
param.documentation: Filter Type

param.name: FILT3_NOTCH_FREQ
param.documentation: Notch Filter center frequency in Hz.

param.name: FILT3_NOTCH_Q
param.documentation: Notch Filter quality factor given by the notch centre frequency divided by its bandwidth.

param.name: FILT3_NOTCH_ATT
param.documentation: Notch Filter attenuation in dB.

param.name: FILT4_TYPE
param.documentation: Filter Type

param.name: FILT4_NOTCH_FREQ
param.documentation: Notch Filter center frequency in Hz.

param.name: FILT4_NOTCH_Q
param.documentation: Notch Filter quality factor given by the notch centre frequency divided by its bandwidth.

param.name: FILT4_NOTCH_ATT
param.documentation: Notch Filter attenuation in dB.

param.name: FILT5_TYPE
param.documentation: Filter Type

param.name: FILT5_NOTCH_FREQ
param.documentation: Notch Filter center frequency in Hz.

param.name: FILT5_NOTCH_Q
param.documentation: Notch Filter quality factor given by the notch centre frequency divided by its bandwidth.

param.name: FILT5_NOTCH_ATT
param.documentation: Notch Filter attenuation in dB.

param.name: FILT6_TYPE
param.documentation: Filter Type

param.name: FILT6_NOTCH_FREQ
param.documentation: Notch Filter center frequency in Hz.

param.name: FILT6_NOTCH_Q
param.documentation: Notch Filter quality factor given by the notch centre frequency divided by its bandwidth.

param.name: FILT6_NOTCH_ATT
param.documentation: Notch Filter attenuation in dB.

param.name: FILT7_TYPE
param.documentation: Filter Type

param.name: FILT7_NOTCH_FREQ
param.documentation: Notch Filter center frequency in Hz.

param.name: FILT7_NOTCH_Q
param.documentation: Notch Filter quality factor given by the notch centre frequency divided by its bandwidth.

param.name: FILT7_NOTCH_ATT
param.documentation: Notch Filter attenuation in dB.

param.name: FILT8_TYPE
param.documentation: Filter Type

param.name: FILT8_NOTCH_FREQ
param.documentation: Notch Filter center frequency in Hz.

param.name: FILT8_NOTCH_Q
param.documentation: Notch Filter quality factor given by the notch centre frequency divided by its bandwidth.

param.name: FILT8_NOTCH_ATT
param.documentation: Notch Filter attenuation in dB.

param.name: FINS_FREQ_HZ
param.documentation: This is the oscillation frequency of the fins

param.name: FINS_TURBO_MODE
param.documentation: Enables double speed on high offset.

param.name: FRSKY_UPLINK_ID
param.documentation: Change the uplink sensor id (SPort only)

param.name: FRSKY_DNLINK1_ID
param.documentation: Change the first extra downlink sensor id (SPort only)

param.name: FRSKY_DNLINK2_ID
param.documentation: Change the second extra downlink sensor id (SPort only)

param.name: FRSKY_DNLINK_ID
param.documentation: Change the default downlink sensor id (SPort only)

param.name: FRSKY_OPTIONS
param.documentation: A bitmask to set some FRSky Telemetry specific options

param.name: GEN_TYPE
param.documentation: Generator type

param.name: GEN_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Bitmask of options for generators

param.name: GEN_L_MNT_TIME
param.documentation: Seconds until maintenance required

param.name: GEN_L_RUNTIME
param.documentation: Total time this generator has run in seconds

param.name: GEN_L_IDLE_TH_H
param.documentation: throttle value to use when warming up or cooling down

param.name: GEN_L_IDLE_TH
param.documentation: throttle value to use when idling

param.name: GEN_L_RUN_TEMP
param.documentation: temperature required for generator to start producing power in deg celsius

param.name: GEN_L_IDLE_TEMP
param.documentation: temperature required for generator to return to idle after having run

param.humanName: Cylinder Head Over Temperature Warning Level
param.name: GEN_L_OVER_TEMP
param.documentation: threshold temperature for the cylinder head above which the mavlink over temperature message gets sent

param.name: GPS_NAVFILTER
param.documentation: Navigation filter engine setting

param.name: GPS_AUTO_SWITCH
param.documentation: Automatic switchover to GPS reporting best lock, 1:UseBest selects the GPS with highest status, if both are equal the GPS with highest satellite count is used 4:Use primary if 3D fix or better, will revert to 'UseBest' behaviour if 3D fix is lost on primary

values.value: Use primary if 3D fix or better

param.name: GPS_SBAS_MODE
param.documentation: This sets the SBAS (satellite based augmentation system) mode if available on this GPS. If set to 2 then the SBAS mode is not changed in the GPS. Otherwise the GPS will be reconfigured to enable/disable SBAS. Disabling SBAS may be worthwhile in some parts of the world where an SBAS signal is available but the baseline is too long to be useful.

param.name: GPS_MIN_ELEV
param.documentation: This sets the minimum elevation of satellites above the horizon for them to be used for navigation. Setting this to -100 leaves the minimum elevation set to the GPS modules default.

param.name: GPS_INJECT_TO
param.documentation: The GGS can send raw serial packets to inject data to multiple GPSes.

param.name: GPS_SBP_LOGMASK
param.documentation: Masked with the SBP msg_type field to determine whether SBR1/SBR2 data is logged

param.name: GPS_RAW_DATA
param.documentation: Handles logging raw data; on uBlox chips that support raw data this will log RXM messages into logger; on Septentrio this will log on the equipment's SD card and when set to 2, the autopilot will try to stop logging after disarming and restart after arming

values.value: Only log every five samples (uBlox only)

param.name: GPS_SAVE_CFG
param.documentation: Determines whether the configuration for this GPS should be written to non-volatile memory on the GPS. Currently working for UBlox 6 series and above.

param.name: GPS_AUTO_CONFIG
param.documentation: Controls if the autopilot should automatically configure the GPS based on the parameters and default settings

values.value: Enable automatic configuration for Serial GPSes only
Enable automatic configuration for DroneCAN as well

param.name: GPS_BLEND_MASK
param.documentation: Determines which of the accuracy measures Horizontal position, Vertical Position and Speed are used to calculate the weighting on each GPS receiver when soft switching has been selected by setting GPS_AUTO_SWITCH to 2(Blend)

param.name: GPS_DRV_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Additional backend specific options

bitmask.bit: Use UART2 for moving baseline on ublox
Use base station for GPS yaw on SBF
Use dedicated CAN port b/w GPSes for moving baseline
Use ellipsoid height instead of AMSL
Override GPS satellite health of L5 band from L1 health
Enable RTCM full parse even for a single channel
Disable automatic full RTCM parsing when RTCM seen on more than one channel

param.field: 0:Use UART2 for moving baseline on ublox,1:Use base station for GPS yaw on SBF,2:Use baudrate 115200 on ublox,3:Use dedicated CAN port b/w GPSes for moving baseline,4:Use ellipsoid height instead of AMSL, 5:Override GPS satellite health of L5 band from L1 health, 6:Enable RTCM full parse even for a single channel, 7:Disable automatic full RTCM parsing when RTCM seen on more than one channel

param.name: GPS_PRIMARY
param.documentation: This GPS will be used when GPS_AUTO_SWITCH is 0 and used preferentially with GPS_AUTO_SWITCH = 4.

param.name: GPS_TYPE
param.documentation: GPS type of 1st GPS.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_TYPE

param.name: GPS_TYPE2
param.documentation: GPS type of 2nd GPS

param.name: GPS_GNSS_MODE
param.documentation: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the first GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured).Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_GNSS_MODE.

param.name: GPS_GNSS_MODE2
param.documentation: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the second GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured). Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS2_GNSS_MODE

param.name: GPS_RATE_MS
param.documentation: Controls how often the GPS should provide a position update. Lowering below 5Hz(default) is not allowed. Raising the rate above 5Hz usually provides little benefit and for some GPS (eg Ublox M9N) can severely impact performance.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_RATE_MS

param.name: GPS_RATE_MS2
param.documentation: Controls how often the GPS should provide a position update. Lowering below 5Hz(default) is not allowed. Raising the rate above 5Hz usually provides little benefit and for some GPS (eg Ublox M9N) can severely impact performance.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS2_RATE_MS

param.name: GPS_POS1_X
param.documentation: X position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_POS_X.

param.name: GPS_POS1_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_POS_Y.

param.name: GPS_POS1_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_POS_Z.

param.name: GPS_POS2_X
param.documentation: X position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS2_POS_X.

param.name: GPS_POS2_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS2_POS_Y.

param.name: GPS_POS2_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS2_POS_Z.

param.name: GPS_DELAY_MS
param.documentation: Controls the amount of GPS measurement delay that the autopilot compensates for. Set to zero to use the default delay for the detected GPS type.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_DELAY_MS.

param.name: GPS_DELAY_MS2
param.documentation: Controls the amount of GPS measurement delay that the autopilot compensates for. Set to zero to use the default delay for the detected GPS type.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS2_DELAY_MS.

param.name: GPS_COM_PORT
param.documentation: The physical COM port on the connected device, currently only applies to SBF and GSOF GPS,Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_COM_PORT.

param.name: GPS_COM_PORT2
param.documentation: The physical COM port on the connected device, currently only applies to SBF and GSOF GPS.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_COM_PORT.

param.name: GPS_CAN_NODEID1
param.documentation: GPS Node id for first-discovered GPS.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_CAN_NODEID.

param.name: GPS_CAN_NODEID2
param.documentation: GPS Node id for second-discovered GPS.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS2_CAN_NODEID.

param.name: GRIP_CAN_ID
param.documentation: Refer to https://docs.zubax.com/opengrab_epm_v3#UAVCAN_interface

param.name: GRIP_AUTOCLOSE
param.documentation: Time in seconds that gripper close the gripper after opening; 0 to disable

param.name: INS_GYRO_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter cutoff frequency for gyroscopes. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

param.name: INS_ACCEL_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter cutoff frequency for accelerometers. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

param.humanName: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE
param.documentation: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE2
param.documentation: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.name: INS_USE3
param.documentation: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Stillness threshold for detecting if we are moving
param.name: INS_STILL_THRESH
param.documentation: Threshold to tolerate vibration to determine if vehicle is motionless. This depends on the frame type and if there is a constant vibration due to motors before launch or after landing. Total motionless is about 0.05. Suggested values: Planes/rover use 0.1, multirotors use 1, tradHeli uses 5

param.name: INS_GYR_CAL
param.documentation: Conrols when automatic gyro calibration is performed

param.name: INS_TRIM_OPTION
param.documentation: Specifies how the accel cal routine determines the trims

values.value: Assume ACC_BODYFIX is perfectly aligned to the vehicle

param.name: INS_ACC_BODYFIX
param.documentation: The body-fixed accelerometer to be used for trim calculation

param.name: INS_POS1_X
param.documentation: X position of the first IMU Accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.name: INS_POS1_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.name: INS_FAST_SAMPLE
param.documentation: Mask of IMUs to enable fast sampling on, if available

param.name: INS_ENABLE_MASK
param.documentation: Bitmask of IMUs to enable. It can be used to prevent startup of specific detected IMUs

param.humanName: Gyro rate for IMUs with Fast Sampling enabled
param.name: INS_GYRO_RATE
param.documentation: Gyro rate for IMUs with fast sampling enabled. The gyro rate is the sample rate at which the IMU filters operate and needs to be at least double the maximum filter frequency. If the sensor does not support the selected rate the next highest supported rate will be used. For IMUs which do not support fast sampling this setting is ignored and the default gyro rate of 1Khz is used.

param.name: INS_TCAL_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This enables optional temperature calibration features. Setting of the Persist bits will save the temperature and/or accelerometer calibration parameters in the bootloader sector on the next update of the bootloader.

param.name: INS_RAW_LOG_OPT
param.documentation: Raw logging options bitmask
param.field: 0:Log primary gyro only, 1:Log all gyros, 2:Post filter, 3: Pre and post filter
